      <article class="book" id="R.1">
         <header class="book-titlepage">
            <h1>The History of Troilus and Cressida</h1>
         </header>
         <div class="lists-of-titles">
            <div class="toc">
               <p>

               </p>

         <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
            <header class="preface-titlepage">
               <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
            </header>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">PRIAM, king of Troy.</span>
            </p>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">HECTOR</span>
                        <span class="personname">TROILUS</span>
                        <span class="personname">PARIS</span>
                        <span class="personname">DEIPHOBUS</span>
                        <span class="personname">HELENUS</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">his sons.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">MARGARELON, a bastard son of Priam.</span>
            </p>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">AENEAS</span>
                        <span class="personname">ANTENOR</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">Trojan commanders.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">CALCHAS, a Trojan priest, taking part with the Greeks.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">PANDARUS, uncle to Cressida.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">AGAMEMNON, the Grecian general.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">MENELAUS, his brother.</span>
            </p>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">ACHILLES</span>
                        <span class="personname">AJAX</span>
                        <span class="personname">ULYSSES</span>
                        <span class="personname">NESTOR</span>
                        <span class="personname">DIOMEDES</span>
                        <span class="personname">PATROCLUS</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">Grecian princes.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">THERSITES, a deformed and scurrilous Grecian.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">ALEXANDER, servant to Cressida.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Servant to Troilus. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Servant to Paris.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Servant to Diomedes. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">HELEN, wife to Menelaus.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">ANDROMACHE, wife to Hector.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">CASSANDRA, daughter to Priam, a prophetess.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">CRESSIDA, daughter to Calchas.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Trojan and Greek Soldiers, and Attendants.</span>
            </p>
            <p>SCENE  Troy, and the Grecian camp before it.</p>
         </article>
         <article class="preface" id="R.1.3">
            <header class="preface-titlepage">
               <h2>PROLOGUE</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="dialogue">
               <div class="linegroup">
                  <div class="speaker"/>
                  <div class="line">In Troy, there lies the scene. From isles of Greece</div>
                  <div class="line">The princes orgulous, their high blood chafed,</div>
                  <div class="line">Have to the port of Athens sent their ships,</div>
                  <div class="line">Fraught with the ministers and instruments</div>
                  <div class="line">Of cruel war: sixty and nine, that wore</div>
                  <div class="line">Their crownets regal, from the Athenian bay</div>
                  <div class="line">Put forth toward Phrygia; and their vow is made</div>
                  <div class="line">To ransack Troy, within whose strong immures</div>
                  <div class="line">The ravish'd Helen, Menelaus' queen,</div>
                  <div class="line">With wanton Paris sleeps; and that's the quarrel.</div>
                  <div class="line">To Tenedos they come;</div>
                  <div class="line">And the deep-drawing barks do there disgorge</div>
                  <div class="line">Their warlike fraughtage: now on Dardan plains</div>
                  <div class="line">The fresh and yet unbruised Greeks do pitch</div>
                  <div class="line">Their brave pavilions: Priam's six-gated city,</div>
                  <div class="line">Dardan, and Tymbria, Helias, Chetas, Troien,</div>
                  <div class="line">And Antenorides, with massy staples</div>
                  <div class="line">And corresponsive and fulfilling bolts,</div>
                  <div class="line">Sperr up the sons of Troy.</div>
                  <div class="line">Now expectation, tickling skittish spirits,</div>
                  <div class="line">On one and other side, Trojan and Greek,</div>
                  <div class="line">Sets all on hazard: and hither am I come</div>
                  <div class="line">A prologue arm'd, but not in confidence</div>
                  <div class="line">Of author's pen or actor's voice, but suited</div>
                  <div class="line">In like conditions as our argument,</div>
                  <div class="line">To tell you, fair beholders, that our play</div>
                  <div class="line">Leaps o'er the vaunt and firstlings of those broils,</div>
                  <div class="line">Beginning in the middle, starting thence away</div>
                  <div class="line">To what may be digested in a play.</div>
                  <div class="line">Like or find fault; do as your pleasures are:</div>
                  <div class="line">Now good or bad, 'tis but the chance of war.</div>
               </div>
            </div>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.4">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.2">1. SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.3">2. SCENE II.  The Same. A street.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.4">3. SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Agamemnon's tent.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter TROILUS armed, and PANDARUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Call here my varlet; I'll unarm again:</div>
                     <div class="line">Why should I war without the walls of Troy,</div>
                     <div class="line">That find such cruel battle here within?</div>
                     <div class="line">Each Trojan that is master of his heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let him to field; Troilus, alas! hath none.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Will this gear ne'er be mended?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The Greeks are strong and skilful to their strength,</div>
                     <div class="line">Fierce to their skill and to their fierceness valiant;</div>
                     <div class="line">But I am weaker than a woman's tear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Tamer than sleep, fonder than ignorance,</div>
                     <div class="line">Less valiant than the virgin in the night</div>
                     <div class="line">And skilless as unpractised infancy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, I have told you enough of this: for my part,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll not meddle nor make no further. He that will</div>
                     <div class="line">have a cake out of the wheat must needs tarry the grinding.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Have I not tarried?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, the grinding; but you must tarry</div>
                     <div class="line">the bolting.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Have I not tarried?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, the bolting, but you must tarry the leavening.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Still have I tarried.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, to the leavening; but here's yet in the word</div>
                     <div class="line">'hereafter' the kneading, the making of the cake, the</div>
                     <div class="line">heating of the oven and the baking; nay, you must</div>
                     <div class="line">stay the cooling too, or you may chance to burn your lips.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Patience herself, what goddess e'er she be,</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth lesser blench at sufferance than I do.</div>
                     <div class="line">At Priam's royal table do I sit;</div>
                     <div class="line">And when fair Cressid comes into my thoughts,--</div>
                     <div class="line">So, traitor! 'When she comes!' When is she thence?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, she looked yesternight fairer than ever I saw</div>
                     <div class="line">her look, or any woman else.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I was about to tell thee:--when my heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">As wedged with a sigh, would rive in twain,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lest Hector or my father should perceive me,</div>
                     <div class="line">I have, as when the sun doth light a storm,</div>
                     <div class="line">Buried this sigh in wrinkle of a smile:</div>
                     <div class="line">But sorrow, that is couch'd in seeming gladness,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is like that mirth fate turns to sudden sadness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">An her hair were not somewhat darker than Helen's--</div>
                     <div class="line">well, go to--there were no more comparison between</div>
                     <div class="line">the women: but, for my part, she is my kinswoman; I</div>
                     <div class="line">would not, as they term it, praise her: but I would</div>
                     <div class="line">somebody had heard her talk yesterday, as I did. I</div>
                     <div class="line">will not dispraise your sister Cassandra's wit, but--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">O Pandarus! I tell thee, Pandarus,--</div>
                     <div class="line">When I do tell thee, there my hopes lie drown'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Reply not in how many fathoms deep</div>
                     <div class="line">They lie indrench'd. I tell thee I am mad</div>
                     <div class="line">In Cressid's love: thou answer'st 'she is fair;'</div>
                     <div class="line">Pour'st in the open ulcer of my heart</div>
                     <div class="line">Her eyes, her hair, her cheek, her gait, her voice,</div>
                     <div class="line">Handlest in thy discourse, O, that her hand,</div>
                     <div class="line">In whose comparison all whites are ink,</div>
                     <div class="line">Writing their own reproach, to whose soft seizure</div>
                     <div class="line">The cygnet's down is harsh and spirit of sense</div>
                     <div class="line">Hard as the palm of ploughman: this thou tell'st me,</div>
                     <div class="line">As true thou tell'st me, when I say I love her;</div>
                     <div class="line">But, saying thus, instead of oil and balm,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou lay'st in every gash that love hath given me</div>
                     <div class="line">The knife that made it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I speak no more than truth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou dost not speak so much.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, I'll not meddle in't. Let her be as she is:</div>
                     <div class="line">if she be fair, 'tis the better for her; an she be</div>
                     <div class="line">not, she has the mends in her own hands.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Good Pandarus, how now, Pandarus!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I have had my labour for my travail; ill-thought on of</div>
                     <div class="line">her and ill-thought on of you; gone between and</div>
                     <div class="line">between, but small thanks for my labour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What, art thou angry, Pandarus? what, with me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Because she's kin to me, therefore she's not so fair</div>
                     <div class="line">as Helen: an she were not kin to me, she would be as</div>
                     <div class="line">fair on Friday as Helen is on Sunday. But what care</div>
                     <div class="line">I? I care not an she were a black-a-moor; 'tis all one to me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Say I she is not fair?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I do not care whether you do or no. She's a fool to</div>
                     <div class="line">stay behind her father; let her to the Greeks; and so</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll tell her the next time I see her: for my part,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll meddle nor make no more i' the matter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Pandarus,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Not I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet Pandarus,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray you, speak no more to me: I will leave all as I</div>
                     <div class="line">found it, and there an end.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit PANDARUS. An alarum</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, you ungracious clamours! peace, rude sounds!</div>
                     <div class="line">Fools on both sides! Helen must needs be fair,</div>
                     <div class="line">When with your blood you daily paint her thus.</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot fight upon this argument;</div>
                     <div class="line">It is too starved a subject for my sword.</div>
                     <div class="line">But Pandarus,--O gods, how do you plague me!</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot come to Cressid but by Pandar;</div>
                     <div class="line">And he's as tetchy to be woo'd to woo.</div>
                     <div class="line">As she is stubborn-chaste against all suit.</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell me, Apollo, for thy Daphne's love,</div>
                     <div class="line">What Cressid is, what Pandar, and what we?</div>
                     <div class="line">Her bed is India; there she lies, a pearl:</div>
                     <div class="line">Between our Ilium and where she resides,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let it be call'd the wild and wandering flood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Ourself the merchant, and this sailing Pandar</div>
                     <div class="line">Our doubtful hope, our convoy and our bark.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Alarum. Enter AENEAS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, Prince Troilus! wherefore not afield?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Because not there: this woman's answer sorts,</div>
                     <div class="line">For womanish it is to be from thence.</div>
                     <div class="line">What news, AEneas, from the field to-day?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                     <div class="line">That Paris is returned home and hurt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">By whom, AEneas?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                     <div class="line">Troilus, by Menelaus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Let Paris bleed; 'tis but a scar to scorn;</div>
                     <div class="line">Paris is gored with Menelaus' horn.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Alarum</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                     <div class="line">Hark, what good sport is out of town to-day!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Better at home, if 'would I might' were 'may.'</div>
                     <div class="line">But to the sport abroad: are you bound thither?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                     <div class="line">In all swift haste.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, go we then together.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  The Same. A street.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CRESSIDA and ALEXANDER</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Who were those went by?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALEXANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">Queen Hecuba and Helen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">And whither go they?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALEXANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">Up to the eastern tower,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose height commands as subject all the vale,</div>
                     <div class="line">To see the battle. Hector, whose patience</div>
                     <div class="line">Is, as a virtue, fix'd, to-day was moved:</div>
                     <div class="line">He chid Andromache and struck his armourer,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, like as there were husbandry in war,</div>
                     <div class="line">Before the sun rose he was harness'd light,</div>
                     <div class="line">And to the field goes he; where every flower</div>
                     <div class="line">Did, as a prophet, weep what it foresaw</div>
                     <div class="line">In Hector's wrath.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">What was his cause of anger?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALEXANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">The noise goes, this: there is among the Greeks</div>
                     <div class="line">A lord of Trojan blood, nephew to Hector;</div>
                     <div class="line">They call him Ajax.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Good; and what of him?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALEXANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">They say he is a very man per se,</div>
                     <div class="line">And stands alone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">So do all men, unless they are drunk, sick, or have no legs.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALEXANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">This man, lady, hath robbed many beasts of their</div>
                     <div class="line">particular additions; he is as valiant as the lion,</div>
                     <div class="line">churlish as the bear, slow as the elephant: a man</div>
                     <div class="line">into whom nature hath so crowded humours that his</div>
                     <div class="line">valour is crushed into folly, his folly sauced with</div>
                     <div class="line">discretion: there is no man hath a virtue that he</div>
                     <div class="line">hath not a glimpse of, nor any man an attaint but he</div>
                     <div class="line">carries some stain of it: he is melancholy without</div>
                     <div class="line">cause, and merry against the hair: he hath the</div>
                     <div class="line">joints of every thing, but everything so out of joint</div>
                     <div class="line">that he is a gouty Briareus, many hands and no use,</div>
                     <div class="line">or purblind Argus, all eyes and no sight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">But how should this man, that makes</div>
                     <div class="line">me smile, make Hector angry?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALEXANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">They say he yesterday coped Hector in the battle and</div>
                     <div class="line">struck him down, the disdain and shame whereof hath</div>
                     <div class="line">ever since kept Hector fasting and waking.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Who comes here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALEXANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, your uncle Pandarus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PANDARUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Hector's a gallant man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALEXANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">As may be in the world, lady.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What's that? what's that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Good morrow, uncle Pandarus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Good morrow, cousin Cressid: what do you talk of?</div>
                     <div class="line">Good morrow, Alexander. How do you, cousin? When</div>
                     <div class="line">were you at Ilium?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">This morning, uncle.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What were you talking of when I came? Was Hector</div>
                     <div class="line">armed and gone ere ye came to Ilium? Helen was not</div>
                     <div class="line">up, was she?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Hector was gone, but Helen was not up.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Even so: Hector was stirring early.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">That were we talking of, and of his anger.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Was he angry?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">So he says here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">True, he was so: I know the cause too: he'll lay</div>
                     <div class="line">about him to-day, I can tell them that: and there's</div>
                     <div class="line">Troilus will not come far behind him: let them take</div>
                     <div class="line">heed of Troilus, I can tell them that too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">What, is he angry too?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, Troilus? Troilus is the better man of the two.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">O Jupiter! there's no comparison.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What, not between Troilus and Hector? Do you know a</div>
                     <div class="line">man if you see him?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, if I ever saw him before and knew him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, I say Troilus is Troilus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Then you say as I say; for, I am sure, he is not Hector.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">No, nor Hector is not Troilus in some degrees.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis just to each of them; he is himself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Himself! Alas, poor Troilus! I would he were.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">So he is.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Condition, I had gone barefoot to India.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">He is not Hector.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Himself! no, he's not himself: would a' were</div>
                     <div class="line">himself! Well, the gods are above; time must friend</div>
                     <div class="line">or end: well, Troilus, well: I would my heart were</div>
                     <div class="line">in her body. No, Hector is not a better man than Troilus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Excuse me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">He is elder.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Pardon me, pardon me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Th' other's not come to't; you shall tell me another</div>
                     <div class="line">tale, when th' other's come to't. Hector shall not</div>
                     <div class="line">have his wit this year.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">He shall not need it, if he have his own.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor his qualities.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">No matter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor his beauty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twould not become him; his own's better.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">You have no judgment, niece: Helen</div>
                     <div class="line">herself swore th' other day, that Troilus, for</div>
                     <div class="line">a brown favour--for so 'tis, I must confess,--</div>
                     <div class="line">not brown neither,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">No, but brown.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Faith, to say truth, brown and not brown.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">To say the truth, true and not true.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">She praised his complexion above Paris.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, Paris hath colour enough.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">So he has.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Then Troilus should have too much: if she praised</div>
                     <div class="line">him above, his complexion is higher than his; he</div>
                     <div class="line">having colour enough, and the other higher, is too</div>
                     <div class="line">flaming a praise for a good complexion. I had as</div>
                     <div class="line">lief Helen's golden tongue had commended Troilus for</div>
                     <div class="line">a copper nose.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I swear to you. I think Helen loves him better than Paris.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Then she's a merry Greek indeed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, I am sure she does. She came to him th' other</div>
                     <div class="line">day into the compassed window,--and, you know, he</div>
                     <div class="line">has not past three or four hairs on his chin,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed, a tapster's arithmetic may soon bring his</div>
                     <div class="line">particulars therein to a total.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, he is very young: and yet will he, within</div>
                     <div class="line">three pound, lift as much as his brother Hector.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Is he so young a man and so old a lifter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">But to prove to you that Helen loves him: she came</div>
                     <div class="line">and puts me her white hand to his cloven chin--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Juno have mercy! how came it cloven?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, you know 'tis dimpled: I think his smiling</div>
                     <div class="line">becomes him better than any man in all Phrygia.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, he smiles valiantly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Does he not?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">O yes, an 'twere a cloud in autumn.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, go to, then: but to prove to you that Helen</div>
                     <div class="line">loves Troilus,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Troilus will stand to the proof, if you'll</div>
                     <div class="line">prove it so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Troilus! why, he esteems her no more than I esteem</div>
                     <div class="line">an addle egg.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">If you love an addle egg as well as you love an idle</div>
                     <div class="line">head, you would eat chickens i' the shell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot choose but laugh, to think how she tickled</div>
                     <div class="line">his chin: indeed, she has a marvellous white hand, I</div>
                     <div class="line">must needs confess,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Without the rack.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">And she takes upon her to spy a white hair on his chin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, poor chin! many a wart is richer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">But there was such laughing! Queen Hecuba laughed</div>
                     <div class="line">that her eyes ran o'er.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">With mill-stones.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">And Cassandra laughed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">But there was more temperate fire under the pot of</div>
                     <div class="line">her eyes: did her eyes run o'er too?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">And Hector laughed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">At what was all this laughing?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, at the white hair that Helen spied on Troilus' chin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">An't had been a green hair, I should have laughed</div>
                     <div class="line">too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">They laughed not so much at the hair as at his pretty answer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">What was his answer?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Quoth she, 'Here's but two and fifty hairs on your</div>
                     <div class="line">chin, and one of them is white.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">This is her question.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">That's true; make no question of that. 'Two and</div>
                     <div class="line">fifty hairs' quoth he, 'and one white: that white</div>
                     <div class="line">hair is my father, and all the rest are his sons.'</div>
                     <div class="line">'Jupiter!' quoth she, 'which of these hairs is Paris,</div>
                     <div class="line">my husband? 'The forked one,' quoth he, 'pluck't</div>
                     <div class="line">out, and give it him.' But there was such laughing!</div>
                     <div class="line">and Helen so blushed, an Paris so chafed, and all the</div>
                     <div class="line">rest so laughed, that it passed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">So let it now; for it has been while going by.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, cousin. I told you a thing yesterday; think on't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">So I do.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll be sworn 'tis true; he will weep you, an 'twere</div>
                     <div class="line">a man born in April.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">And I'll spring up in his tears, an 'twere a nettle</div>
                     <div class="line">against May.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>A retreat sounded</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Hark! they are coming from the field: shall we</div>
                     <div class="line">stand up here, and see them as they pass toward</div>
                     <div class="line">Ilium? good niece, do, sweet niece Cressida.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">At your pleasure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, here, here's an excellent place; here we may</div>
                     <div class="line">see most bravely: I'll tell you them all by their</div>
                     <div class="line">names as they pass by; but mark Troilus above the rest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak not so loud.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>AENEAS passes</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">That's AEneas: is not that a brave man? he's one of</div>
                     <div class="line">the flowers of Troy, I can tell you: but mark</div>
                     <div class="line">Troilus; you shall see anon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>ANTENOR passes</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Who's that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">That's Antenor: he has a shrewd wit, I can tell you;</div>
                     <div class="line">and he's a man good enough, he's one o' the soundest</div>
                     <div class="line">judgments in whosoever, and a proper man of person.</div>
                     <div class="line">When comes Troilus? I'll show you Troilus anon: if</div>
                     <div class="line">he see me, you shall see him nod at me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Will he give you the nod?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">You shall see.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">If he do, the rich shall have more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>HECTOR passes</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">That's Hector, that, that, look you, that; there's a</div>
                     <div class="line">fellow! Go thy way, Hector! There's a brave man,</div>
                     <div class="line">niece. O brave Hector! Look how he looks! there's</div>
                     <div class="line">a countenance! is't not a brave man?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, a brave man!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Is a' not? it does a man's heart good. Look you</div>
                     <div class="line">what hacks are on his helmet! look you yonder, do</div>
                     <div class="line">you see? look you there: there's no jesting;</div>
                     <div class="line">there's laying on, take't off who will, as they say:</div>
                     <div class="line">there be hacks!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Be those with swords?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Swords! any thing, he cares not; an the devil come</div>
                     <div class="line">to him, it's all one: by God's lid, it does one's</div>
                     <div class="line">heart good. Yonder comes Paris, yonder comes Paris.</div>
                     <p>PARIS passes</p>
                     <div class="line">Look ye yonder, niece; is't not a gallant man too,</div>
                     <div class="line">is't not? Why, this is brave now. Who said he came</div>
                     <div class="line">hurt home to-day? he's not hurt: why, this will do</div>
                     <div class="line">Helen's heart good now, ha! Would I could see</div>
                     <div class="line">Troilus now! You shall see Troilus anon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>HELENUS passes</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Who's that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">That's Helenus. I marvel where Troilus is. That's</div>
                     <div class="line">Helenus. I think he went not forth to-day. That's Helenus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Can Helenus fight, uncle?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Helenus? no. Yes, he'll fight indifferent well. I</div>
                     <div class="line">marvel where Troilus is. Hark! do you not hear the</div>
                     <div class="line">people cry 'Troilus'? Helenus is a priest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">What sneaking fellow comes yonder?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>TROILUS passes</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Where? yonder? that's Deiphobus. 'Tis Troilus!</div>
                     <div class="line">there's a man, niece! Hem! Brave Troilus! the</div>
                     <div class="line">prince of chivalry!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, for shame, peace!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Mark him; note him. O brave Troilus! Look well upon</div>
                     <div class="line">him, niece: look you how his sword is bloodied, and</div>
                     <div class="line">his helm more hacked than Hector's, and how he looks,</div>
                     <div class="line">and how he goes! O admirable youth! he ne'er saw</div>
                     <div class="line">three and twenty. Go thy way, Troilus, go thy way!</div>
                     <div class="line">Had I a sister were a grace, or a daughter a goddess,</div>
                     <div class="line">he should take his choice. O admirable man! Paris?</div>
                     <div class="line">Paris is dirt to him; and, I warrant, Helen, to</div>
                     <div class="line">change, would give an eye to boot.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Here come more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Forces pass</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Asses, fools, dolts! chaff and bran, chaff and bran!</div>
                     <div class="line">porridge after meat! I could live and die i' the</div>
                     <div class="line">eyes of Troilus. Ne'er look, ne'er look: the eagles</div>
                     <div class="line">are gone: crows and daws, crows and daws! I had</div>
                     <div class="line">rather be such a man as Troilus than Agamemnon and</div>
                     <div class="line">all Greece.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">There is among the Greeks Achilles, a better man than Troilus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Achilles! a drayman, a porter, a very camel.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Well, well!' why, have you any discretion? have</div>
                     <div class="line">you any eyes? Do you know what a man is? Is not</div>
                     <div class="line">birth, beauty, good shape, discourse, manhood,</div>
                     <div class="line">learning, gentleness, virtue, youth, liberality,</div>
                     <div class="line">and such like, the spice and salt that season a man?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, a minced man: and then to be baked with no date</div>
                     <div class="line">in the pie, for then the man's date's out.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">You are such a woman! one knows not at what ward you</div>
                     <div class="line">lie.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon my back, to defend my belly; upon my wit, to</div>
                     <div class="line">defend my wiles; upon my secrecy, to defend mine</div>
                     <div class="line">honesty; my mask, to defend my beauty; and you, to</div>
                     <div class="line">defend all these: and at all these wards I lie, at a</div>
                     <div class="line">thousand watches.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Say one of your watches.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, I'll watch you for that; and that's one of the</div>
                     <div class="line">chiefest of them too: if I cannot ward what I would</div>
                     <div class="line">not have hit, I can watch you for telling how I took</div>
                     <div class="line">the blow; unless it swell past hiding, and then it's</div>
                     <div class="line">past watching.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">You are such another!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Troilus's Boy</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Boy</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, my lord would instantly speak with you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Where?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Boy</div>
                     <div class="line">At your own house; there he unarms him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Good boy, tell him I come.</div>
                     <p>Exit boy</p>
                     <div class="line">I doubt he be hurt. Fare ye well, good niece.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Adieu, uncle.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll be with you, niece, by and by.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">To bring, uncle?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, a token from Troilus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">By the same token, you are a bawd.</div>
                     <p>Exit PANDARUS</p>
                     <div class="line">Words, vows, gifts, tears, and love's full sacrifice,</div>
                     <div class="line">He offers in another's enterprise;</div>
                     <div class="line">But more in Troilus thousand fold I see</div>
                     <div class="line">Than in the glass of Pandar's praise may be;</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet hold I off. Women are angels, wooing:</div>
                     <div class="line">Things won are done; joy's soul lies in the doing.</div>
                     <div class="line">That she beloved knows nought that knows not this:</div>
                     <div class="line">Men prize the thing ungain'd more than it is:</div>
                     <div class="line">That she was never yet that ever knew</div>
                     <div class="line">Love got so sweet as when desire did sue.</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore this maxim out of love I teach:</div>
                     <div class="line">Achievement is command; ungain'd, beseech:</div>
                     <div class="line">Then though my heart's content firm love doth bear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing of that shall from mine eyes appear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Agamemnon's tent.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Sennet. Enter AGAMEMNON, NESTOR, ULYSSES,
MENELAUS, and others</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AGAMEMNON</div>
                     <div class="line">Princes,</div>
                     <div class="line">What grief hath set the jaundice on your cheeks?</div>
                     <div class="line">The ample proposition that hope makes</div>
                     <div class="line">In all designs begun on earth below</div>
                     <div class="line">Fails in the promised largeness: cheques and disasters</div>
                     <div class="line">Grow in the veins of actions highest rear'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">As knots, by the conflux of meeting sap,</div>
                     <div class="line">Infect the sound pine and divert his grain</div>
                     <div class="line">Tortive and errant from his course of growth.</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor, princes, is it matter new to us</div>
                     <div class="line">That we come short of our suppose so far</div>
                     <div class="line">That after seven years' siege yet Troy walls stand;</div>
                     <div class="line">Sith every action that hath gone before,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whereof we have record, trial did draw</div>
                     <div class="line">Bias and thwart, not answering the aim,</div>
                     <div class="line">And that unbodied figure of the thought</div>
                     <div class="line">That gave't surmised shape. Why then, you princes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you with cheeks abash'd behold our works,</div>
                     <div class="line">And call them shames? which are indeed nought else</div>
                     <div class="line">But the protractive trials of great Jove</div>
                     <div class="line">To find persistive constancy in men:</div>
                     <div class="line">The fineness of which metal is not found</div>
                     <div class="line">In fortune's love; for then the bold and coward,</div>
                     <div class="line">The wise and fool, the artist and unread,</div>
                     <div class="line">The hard and soft seem all affined and kin:</div>
                     <div class="line">But, in the wind and tempest of her frown,</div>
                     <div class="line">Distinction, with a broad and powerful fan,</div>
                     <div class="line">Puffing at all, winnows the light away;</div>
                     <div class="line">And what hath mass or matter, by itself</div>
                     <div class="line">Lies rich in virtue and unmingled.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NESTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">With due observance of thy godlike seat,</div>
                     <div class="line">Great Agamemnon, Nestor shall apply</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy latest words. In the reproof of chance</div>
                     <div class="line">Lies the true proof of men: the sea being smooth,</div>
                     <div class="line">How many shallow bauble boats dare sail</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon her patient breast, making their way</div>
