                     <div class="line">Not making any scruple of her soilure,</div>
                     <div class="line">With such a hell of pain and world of charge,</div>
                     <div class="line">And you as well to keep her, that defend her,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not palating the taste of her dishonour,</div>
                     <div class="line">With such a costly loss of wealth and friends:</div>
                     <div class="line">He, like a puling cuckold, would drink up</div>
                     <div class="line">The lees and dregs of a flat tamed piece;</div>
                     <div class="line">You, like a lecher, out of whorish loins</div>
                     <div class="line">Are pleased to breed out your inheritors:</div>
                     <div class="line">Both merits poised, each weighs nor less nor more;</div>
                     <div class="line">But he as he, the heavier for a whore.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                     <div class="line">You are too bitter to your countrywoman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIOMEDES</div>
                     <div class="line">She's bitter to her country: hear me, Paris:</div>
                     <div class="line">For every false drop in her bawdy veins</div>
                     <div class="line">A Grecian's life hath sunk; for every scruple</div>
                     <div class="line">Of her contaminated carrion weight,</div>
                     <div class="line">A Trojan hath been slain: since she could speak,</div>
                     <div class="line">She hath not given so many good words breath</div>
                     <div class="line">As for her Greeks and Trojans suffer'd death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Fair Diomed, you do as chapmen do,</div>
                     <div class="line">Dispraise the thing that you desire to buy:</div>
                     <div class="line">But we in silence hold this virtue well,</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll but commend what we intend to sell.</div>
                     <div class="line">Here lies our way.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter TROILUS and CRESSIDA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Dear, trouble not yourself: the morn is cold.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, sweet my lord, I'll call mine uncle down;</div>
                     <div class="line">He shall unbolt the gates.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Trouble him not;</div>
                     <div class="line">To bed, to bed: sleep kill those pretty eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">And give as soft attachment to thy senses</div>
                     <div class="line">As infants' empty of all thought!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Good morrow, then.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I prithee now, to bed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Are you a-weary of me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">O Cressida! but that the busy day,</div>
                     <div class="line">Waked by the lark, hath roused the ribald crows,</div>
                     <div class="line">And dreaming night will hide our joys no longer,</div>
                     <div class="line">I would not from thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Night hath been too brief.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Beshrew the witch! with venomous wights she stays</div>
                     <div class="line">As tediously as hell, but flies the grasps of love</div>
                     <div class="line">With wings more momentary-swift than thought.</div>
                     <div class="line">You will catch cold, and curse me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Prithee, tarry:</div>
                     <div class="line">You men will never tarry.</div>
                     <div class="line">O foolish Cressid! I might have still held off,</div>
                     <div class="line">And then you would have tarried. Hark!</div>
                     <div class="line">there's one up.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>  What, 's all the doors open here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">It is your uncle.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">A pestilence on him! now will he be mocking:</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall have such a life!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PANDARUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, how now! how go maidenheads? Here, you</div>
                     <div class="line">maid! where's my cousin Cressid?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Go hang yourself, you naughty mocking uncle!</div>
                     <div class="line">You bring me to do, and then you flout me too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">To do what? to do what? let her say</div>
                     <div class="line">what: what have I brought you to do?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, come, beshrew your heart! you'll ne'er be good,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor suffer others.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha! ha! Alas, poor wretch! ah, poor capocchia!</div>
                     <div class="line">hast not slept to-night? would he not, a naughty</div>
                     <div class="line">man, let it sleep? a bugbear take him!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Did not I tell you? Would he were knock'd i' the head!</div>
                     <p>Knocking within</p>
                     <div class="line">Who's that at door? good uncle, go and see.</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, come you again into my chamber:</div>
                     <div class="line">You smile and mock me, as if I meant naughtily.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha, ha!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, you are deceived, I think of no such thing.</div>
                     <p>Knocking within</p>
                     <div class="line">How earnestly they knock! Pray you, come in:</div>
                     <div class="line">I would not for half Troy have you seen here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt TROILUS and CRESSIDA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Who's there? what's the matter? will you beat</div>
                     <div class="line">down the door? How now! what's the matter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter AENEAS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                     <div class="line">Good morrow, lord, good morrow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Who's there? my Lord AEneas! By my troth,</div>
                     <div class="line">I knew you not: what news with you so early?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                     <div class="line">Is not Prince Troilus here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Here! what should he do here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, he is here, my lord; do not deny him:</div>
                     <div class="line">It doth import him much to speak with me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Is he here, say you? 'tis more than I know, I'll</div>
                     <div class="line">be sworn: for my own part, I came in late. What</div>
                     <div class="line">should he do here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                     <div class="line">Who!--nay, then: come, come, you'll do him wrong</div>
                     <div class="line">ere you're ware: you'll be so true to him, to be</div>
                     <div class="line">false to him: do not you know of him, but yet go</div>
                     <div class="line">fetch him hither; go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter TROILUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">How now! what's the matter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, I scarce have leisure to salute you,</div>
                     <div class="line">My matter is so rash: there is at hand</div>
                     <div class="line">Paris your brother, and Deiphobus,</div>
                     <div class="line">The Grecian Diomed, and our Antenor</div>
                     <div class="line">Deliver'd to us; and for him forthwith,</div>
                     <div class="line">Ere the first sacrifice, within this hour,</div>
                     <div class="line">We must give up to Diomedes' hand</div>
                     <div class="line">The Lady Cressida.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Is it so concluded?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                     <div class="line">By Priam and the general state of Troy:</div>
                     <div class="line">They are at hand and ready to effect it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">How my achievements mock me!</div>
                     <div class="line">I will go meet them: and, my Lord AEneas,</div>
                     <div class="line">We met by chance; you did not find me here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                     <div class="line">Good, good, my lord; the secrets of nature</div>
                     <div class="line">Have not more gift in taciturnity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt TROILUS and AENEAS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Is't possible? no sooner got but lost? The devil</div>
                     <div class="line">take Antenor! the young prince will go mad: a</div>
                     <div class="line">plague upon Antenor! I would they had broke 's neck!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter CRESSIDA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">How now! what's the matter? who was here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, ah!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Why sigh you so profoundly? where's my lord? gone!</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell me, sweet uncle, what's the matter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Would I were as deep under the earth as I am above!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">O the gods! what's the matter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Prithee, get thee in: would thou hadst ne'er been</div>
                     <div class="line">born! I knew thou wouldst be his death. O, poor</div>
                     <div class="line">gentleman! A plague upon Antenor!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Good uncle, I beseech you, on my knees! beseech you,</div>
                     <div class="line">what's the matter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou must be gone, wench, thou must be gone; thou</div>
                     <div class="line">art changed for Antenor: thou must to thy father,</div>
                     <div class="line">and be gone from Troilus: 'twill be his death;</div>
                     <div class="line">'twill be his bane; he cannot bear it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">O you immortal gods! I will not go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou must.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">I will not, uncle: I have forgot my father;</div>
                     <div class="line">I know no touch of consanguinity;</div>
                     <div class="line">No kin no love, no blood, no soul so near me</div>
                     <div class="line">As the sweet Troilus. O you gods divine!</div>
                     <div class="line">Make Cressid's name the very crown of falsehood,</div>
                     <div class="line">If ever she leave Troilus! Time, force, and death,</div>
                     <div class="line">Do to this body what extremes you can;</div>
                     <div class="line">But the strong base and building of my love</div>
                     <div class="line">Is as the very centre of the earth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Drawing all things to it. I'll go in and weep,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Do, do.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Tear my bright hair and scratch my praised cheeks,</div>
                     <div class="line">Crack my clear voice with sobs and break my heart</div>
                     <div class="line">With sounding Troilus. I will not go from Troy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  The same. Street before Pandarus' house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PARIS, TROILUS, AENEAS, DEIPHOBUS, ANTENOR,
and DIOMEDES</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                     <div class="line">It is great morning, and the hour prefix'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Of her delivery to this valiant Greek</div>
                     <div class="line">Comes fast upon. Good my brother Troilus,</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell you the lady what she is to do,</div>
                     <div class="line">And haste her to the purpose.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Walk into her house;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll bring her to the Grecian presently:</div>
                     <div class="line">And to his hand when I deliver her,</div>
                     <div class="line">Think it an altar, and thy brother Troilus</div>
                     <div class="line">A priest there offering to it his own heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                     <div class="line">I know what 'tis to love;</div>
                     <div class="line">And would, as I shall pity, I could help!</div>
                     <div class="line">Please you walk in, my lords.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  The same. Pandarus' house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PANDARUS and CRESSIDA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Be moderate, be moderate.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Why tell you me of moderation?</div>
                     <div class="line">The grief is fine, full, perfect, that I taste,</div>
                     <div class="line">And violenteth in a sense as strong</div>
                     <div class="line">As that which causeth it: how can I moderate it?</div>
                     <div class="line">If I could temporize with my affection,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or brew it to a weak and colder palate,</div>
                     <div class="line">The like allayment could I give my grief.</div>
                     <div class="line">My love admits no qualifying dross;</div>
                     <div class="line">No more my grief, in such a precious loss.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, here, here he comes.</div>
                     <p>Enter TROILUS</p>
                     <div class="line">Ah, sweet ducks!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">O Troilus! Troilus!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Embracing him</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What a pair of spectacles is here!</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me embrace too. 'O heart,' as the goodly saying is,</div>
                     <div class="line">'--O heart, heavy heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">Why sigh'st thou without breaking?</div>
                     <div class="line">where he answers again,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Because thou canst not ease thy smart</div>
                     <div class="line">By friendship nor by speaking.'</div>
                     <div class="line">There was never a truer rhyme. Let us cast away</div>
                     <div class="line">nothing, for we may live to have need of such a</div>
                     <div class="line">verse: we see it, we see it. How now, lambs?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Cressid, I love thee in so strain'd a purity,</div>
                     <div class="line">That the bless'd gods, as angry with my fancy,</div>
                     <div class="line">More bright in zeal than the devotion which</div>
                     <div class="line">Cold lips blow to their deities, take thee from me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Have the gods envy?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, ay, ay, ay; 'tis too plain a case.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">And is it true that I must go from Troy?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">A hateful truth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">What, and from Troilus too?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">From Troy and Troilus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Is it possible?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">And suddenly; where injury of chance</div>
                     <div class="line">Puts back leave-taking, justles roughly by</div>
                     <div class="line">All time of pause, rudely beguiles our lips</div>
                     <div class="line">Of all rejoindure, forcibly prevents</div>
                     <div class="line">Our lock'd embrasures, strangles our dear vows</div>
                     <div class="line">Even in the birth of our own labouring breath:</div>
                     <div class="line">We two, that with so many thousand sighs</div>
                     <div class="line">Did buy each other, must poorly sell ourselves</div>
                     <div class="line">With the rude brevity and discharge of one.</div>
                     <div class="line">Injurious time now with a robber's haste</div>
                     <div class="line">Crams his rich thievery up, he knows not how:</div>
                     <div class="line">As many farewells as be stars in heaven,</div>
                     <div class="line">With distinct breath and consign'd kisses to them,</div>
                     <div class="line">He fumbles up into a lose adieu,</div>
                     <div class="line">And scants us with a single famish'd kiss,</div>
                     <div class="line">Distasted with the salt of broken tears.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>  My lord, is the lady ready?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Hark! you are call'd: some say the Genius so</div>
                     <div class="line">Cries 'come' to him that instantly must die.</div>
                     <div class="line">Bid them have patience; she shall come anon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Where are my tears? rain, to lay this wind, or</div>
                     <div class="line">my heart will be blown up by the root.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">I must then to the Grecians?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">No remedy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">A woful Cressid 'mongst the merry Greeks!</div>
                     <div class="line">When shall we see again?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Hear me, my love: be thou but true of heart,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">I true! how now! what wicked deem is this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, we must use expostulation kindly,</div>
                     <div class="line">For it is parting from us:</div>
                     <div class="line">I speak not 'be thou true,' as fearing thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">For I will throw my glove to Death himself,</div>
                     <div class="line">That there's no maculation in thy heart:</div>
                     <div class="line">But 'be thou true,' say I, to fashion in</div>
                     <div class="line">My sequent protestation; be thou true,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I will see thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, you shall be exposed, my lord, to dangers</div>
                     <div class="line">As infinite as imminent! but I'll be true.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">And I'll grow friend with danger. Wear this sleeve.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">And you this glove. When shall I see you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I will corrupt the Grecian sentinels,</div>
                     <div class="line">To give thee nightly visitation.</div>
                     <div class="line">But yet be true.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">O heavens! 'be true' again!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Hear while I speak it, love:</div>
                     <div class="line">The Grecian youths are full of quality;</div>
                     <div class="line">They're loving, well composed with gifts of nature,</div>
                     <div class="line">Flowing and swelling o'er with arts and exercise:</div>
                     <div class="line">How novelty may move, and parts with person,</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, a kind of godly jealousy--</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, I beseech you, call a virtuous sin--</div>
                     <div class="line">Makes me afeard.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">O heavens! you love me not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Die I a villain, then!</div>
                     <div class="line">In this I do not call your faith in question</div>
                     <div class="line">So mainly as my merit: I cannot sing,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor heel the high lavolt, nor sweeten talk,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor play at subtle games; fair virtues all,</div>
                     <div class="line">To which the Grecians are most prompt and pregnant:</div>
                     <div class="line">But I can tell that in each grace of these</div>
                     <div class="line">There lurks a still and dumb-discoursive devil</div>
                     <div class="line">That tempts most cunningly: but be not tempted.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you think I will?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">No.</div>
                     <div class="line">But something may be done that we will not:</div>
                     <div class="line">And sometimes we are devils to ourselves,</div>
                     <div class="line">When we will tempt the frailty of our powers,</div>
                     <div class="line">Presuming on their changeful potency.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>  Nay, good my lord,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, kiss; and let us part.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>  Brother Troilus!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Good brother, come you hither;</div>
                     <div class="line">And bring AEneas and the Grecian with you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, will you be true?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, I? alas, it is my vice, my fault:</div>
                     <div class="line">Whiles others fish with craft for great opinion,</div>
                     <div class="line">I with great truth catch mere simplicity;</div>
                     <div class="line">Whilst some with cunning gild their copper crowns,</div>
                     <div class="line">With truth and plainness I do wear mine bare.</div>
                     <div class="line">Fear not my truth: the moral of my wit</div>
                     <div class="line">Is 'plain and true;' there's all the reach of it.</div>
                     <p>Enter AENEAS, PARIS, ANTENOR, DEIPHOBUS,
and DIOMEDES</p>
                     <div class="line">Welcome, Sir Diomed! here is the lady</div>
                     <div class="line">Which for Antenor we deliver you:</div>
                     <div class="line">At the port, lord, I'll give her to thy hand,</div>
                     <div class="line">And by the way possess thee what she is.</div>
                     <div class="line">Entreat her fair; and, by my soul, fair Greek,</div>
                     <div class="line">If e'er thou stand at mercy of my sword,</div>
                     <div class="line">Name Cressida and thy life shall be as safe</div>
                     <div class="line">As Priam is in Ilion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIOMEDES</div>
                     <div class="line">Fair Lady Cressid,</div>
                     <div class="line">So please you, save the thanks this prince expects:</div>
                     <div class="line">The lustre in your eye, heaven in your cheek,</div>
                     <div class="line">Pleads your fair usage; and to Diomed</div>
                     <div class="line">You shall be mistress, and command him wholly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Grecian, thou dost not use me courteously,</div>
                     <div class="line">To shame the zeal of my petition to thee</div>
                     <div class="line">In praising her: I tell thee, lord of Greece,</div>
                     <div class="line">She is as far high-soaring o'er thy praises</div>
                     <div class="line">As thou unworthy to be call'd her servant.</div>
                     <div class="line">I charge thee use her well, even for my charge;</div>
                     <div class="line">For, by the dreadful Pluto, if thou dost not,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though the great bulk Achilles be thy guard,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll cut thy throat.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIOMEDES</div>
                     <div class="line">O, be not moved, Prince Troilus:</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me be privileged by my place and message,</div>
                     <div class="line">To be a speaker free; when I am hence</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll answer to my lust: and know you, lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll nothing do on charge: to her own worth</div>
                     <div class="line">She shall be prized; but that you say 'be't so,'</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll speak it in my spirit and honour, 'no.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, to the port. I'll tell thee, Diomed,</div>
                     <div class="line">This brave shall oft make thee to hide thy head.</div>
                     <div class="line">Lady, give me your hand, and, as we walk,</div>
                     <div class="line">To our own selves bend we our needful talk.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt TROILUS, CRESSIDA, and DIOMEDES</p>
               <p>Trumpet within</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Hark! Hector's trumpet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                     <div class="line">How have we spent this morning!</div>
                     <div class="line">The prince must think me tardy and remiss,</div>
                     <div class="line">That sore to ride before him to the field.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis Troilus' fault: come, come, to field with him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEIPHOBUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Let us make ready straight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, with a bridegroom's fresh alacrity,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let us address to tend on Hector's heels:</div>
                     <div class="line">The glory of our Troy doth this day lie</div>
                     <div class="line">On his fair worth and single chivalry.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.6">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>5. SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter AJAX, armed; AGAMEMNON, ACHILLES, PATROCLUS,
MENELAUS, ULYSSES, NESTOR, and others</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AGAMEMNON</div>
                     <div class="line">Here art thou in appointment fresh and fair,</div>
                     <div class="line">Anticipating time with starting courage.</div>
                     <div class="line">Give with thy trumpet a loud note to Troy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou dreadful Ajax; that the appalled air</div>
                     <div class="line">May pierce the head of the great combatant</div>
                     <div class="line">And hale him hither.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AJAX</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou, trumpet, there's my purse.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now crack thy lungs, and split thy brazen pipe:</div>
                     <div class="line">Blow, villain, till thy sphered bias cheek</div>
                     <div class="line">Outswell the colic of puff'd Aquilon:</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, stretch thy chest and let thy eyes spout blood;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou blow'st for Hector.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Trumpet sounds</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ULYSSES</div>
                     <div class="line">No trumpet answers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis but early days.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AGAMEMNON</div>
                     <div class="line">Is not yond Diomed, with Calchas' daughter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ULYSSES</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis he, I ken the manner of his gait;</div>
                     <div class="line">He rises on the toe: that spirit of his</div>
                     <div class="line">In aspiration lifts him from the earth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter DIOMEDES, with CRESSIDA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AGAMEMNON</div>
                     <div class="line">Is this the Lady Cressid?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIOMEDES</div>
                     <div class="line">Even she.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AGAMEMNON</div>
                     <div class="line">Most dearly welcome to the Greeks, sweet lady.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NESTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Our general doth salute you with a kiss.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ULYSSES</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet is the kindness but particular;</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twere better she were kiss'd in general.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NESTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">And very courtly counsel: I'll begin.</div>
                     <div class="line">So much for Nestor.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll take what winter from your lips, fair lady:</div>
                     <div class="line">Achilles bids you welcome.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENELAUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I had good argument for kissing once.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PATROCLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">But that's no argument for kissing now;</div>
                     <div class="line">For this popp'd Paris in his hardiment,</div>
                     <div class="line">And parted thus you and your argument.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ULYSSES</div>
                     <div class="line">O deadly gall, and theme of all our scorns!</div>
                     <div class="line">For which we lose our heads to gild his horns.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PATROCLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The first was Menelaus' kiss; this, mine:</div>
                     <div class="line">Patroclus kisses you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENELAUS</div>
                     <div class="line">O, this is trim!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PATROCLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Paris and I kiss evermore for him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENELAUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll have my kiss, sir. Lady, by your leave.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">In kissing, do you render or receive?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PATROCLUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Both take and give.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll make my match to live,</div>
                     <div class="line">The kiss you take is better than you give;</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore no kiss.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENELAUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll give you boot, I'll give you three for one.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">You're an odd man; give even or give none.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENELAUS</div>
                     <div class="line">An odd man, lady! every man is odd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">No, Paris is not; for you know 'tis true,</div>
                     <div class="line">That you are odd, and he is even with you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENELAUS</div>
                     <div class="line">You fillip me o' the head.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">No, I'll be sworn.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ULYSSES</div>
                     <div class="line">It were no match, your nail against his horn.</div>
                     <div class="line">May I, sweet lady, beg a kiss of you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">You may.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ULYSSES</div>
                     <div class="line">I do desire it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, beg, then.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ULYSSES</div>
                     <div class="line">Why then for Venus' sake, give me a kiss,</div>
                     <div class="line">When Helen is a maid again, and his.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">I am your debtor, claim it when 'tis due.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ULYSSES</div>
                     <div class="line">Never's my day, and then a kiss of you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIOMEDES</div>
                     <div class="line">Lady, a word: I'll bring you to your father.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit with CRESSIDA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NESTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">A woman of quick sense.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ULYSSES</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie, fie upon her!</div>
                     <div class="line">There's language in her eye, her cheek, her lip,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, her foot speaks; her wanton spirits look out</div>
                     <div class="line">At every joint and motive of her body.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, these encounterers, so glib of tongue,</div>
                     <div class="line">That give accosting welcome ere it comes,</div>
                     <div class="line">And wide unclasp the tables of their thoughts</div>
                     <div class="line">To every ticklish reader! set them down</div>
                     <div class="line">For sluttish spoils of opportunity</div>
                     <div class="line">And daughters of the game.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Trumpet within</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALL</div>
                     <div class="line">The Trojans' trumpet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AGAMEMNON</div>
                     <div class="line">Yonder comes the troop.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter HECTOR, armed; AENEAS, TROILUS, and other
Trojans, with Attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                     <div class="line">Hail, all you state of Greece! what shall be done</div>
                     <div class="line">To him that victory commands? or do you purpose</div>
                     <div class="line">A victor shall be known? will you the knights</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall to the edge of all extremity</div>
                     <div class="line">Pursue each other, or shall be divided</div>
                     <div class="line">By any voice or order of the field?</div>
                     <div class="line">Hector bade ask.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AGAMEMNON</div>
                     <div class="line">Which way would Hector have it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                     <div class="line">He cares not; he'll obey conditions.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis done like Hector; but securely done,</div>
                     <div class="line">A little proudly, and great deal misprizing</div>
                     <div class="line">The knight opposed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                     <div class="line">If not Achilles, sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">What is your name?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                     <div class="line">If not Achilles, nothing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore Achilles: but, whate'er, know this:</div>
                     <div class="line">In the extremity of great and little,</div>
                     <div class="line">Valour and pride excel themselves in Hector;</div>
                     <div class="line">The one almost as infinite as all,</div>
                     <div class="line">The other blank as nothing. Weigh him well,</div>
                     <div class="line">And that which looks like pride is courtesy.</div>
                     <div class="line">This Ajax is half made of Hector's blood:</div>
                     <div class="line">In love whereof, half Hector stays at home;</div>
                     <div class="line">Half heart, half hand, half Hector comes to seek</div>
                     <div class="line">This blended knight, half Trojan and half Greek.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                     <div class="line">A maiden battle, then? O, I perceive you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter DIOMEDES</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AGAMEMNON</div>
                     <div class="line">Here is Sir Diomed. Go, gentle knight,</div>
                     <div class="line">Stand by our Ajax: as you and Lord AEneas</div>
                     <div class="line">Consent upon the order of their fight,</div>
                     <div class="line">So be it; either to the uttermost,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or else a breath: the combatants being kin</div>
                     <div class="line">Half stints their strife before their strokes begin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>AJAX and HECTOR enter the lists</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ULYSSES</div>
                     <div class="line">They are opposed already.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AGAMEMNON</div>
                     <div class="line">What Trojan is that same that looks so heavy?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ULYSSES</div>
                     <div class="line">The youngest son of Priam, a true knight,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not yet mature, yet matchless, firm of word,</div>
                     <div class="line">Speaking in deeds and deedless in his tongue;</div>
                     <div class="line">Not soon provoked nor being provoked soon calm'd:</div>
                     <div class="line">His heart and hand both open and both free;</div>
                     <div class="line">For what he has he gives, what thinks he shows;</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet gives he not till judgment guide his bounty,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor dignifies an impure thought with breath;</div>
                     <div class="line">Manly as Hector, but more dangerous;</div>
                     <div class="line">For Hector in his blaze of wrath subscribes</div>
                     <div class="line">To tender objects, but he in heat of action</div>
                     <div class="line">Is more vindicative than jealous love:</div>
                     <div class="line">They call him Troilus, and on him erect</div>
                     <div class="line">A second hope, as fairly built as Hector.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus says AEneas; one that knows the youth</div>
                     <div class="line">Even to his inches, and with private soul</div>
                     <div class="line">Did in great Ilion thus translate him to me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Alarum. Hector and Ajax fight</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AGAMEMNON</div>
                     <div class="line">They are in action.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NESTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, Ajax, hold thine own!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Hector, thou sleep'st;</div>
                     <div class="line">Awake thee!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AGAMEMNON</div>
                     <div class="line">His blows are well disposed: there, Ajax!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIOMEDES</div>
                     <div class="line">You must no more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Trumpets cease</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                     <div class="line">Princes, enough, so please you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AJAX</div>
                     <div class="line">I am not warm yet; let us fight again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIOMEDES</div>
                     <div class="line">As Hector pleases.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HECTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then will I no more:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art, great lord, my father's sister's son,</div>
                     <div class="line">A cousin-german to great Priam's seed;</div>
                     <div class="line">The obligation of our blood forbids</div>
                     <div class="line">A gory emulation 'twixt us twain:</div>
                     <div class="line">Were thy commixtion Greek and Trojan so</div>
                     <div class="line">That thou couldst say 'This hand is Grecian all,</div>
                     <div class="line">And this is Trojan; the sinews of this leg</div>
                     <div class="line">All Greek, and this all Troy; my mother's blood</div>
                     <div class="line">Runs on the dexter cheek, and this sinister</div>
                     <div class="line">Bounds in my father's;' by Jove multipotent,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou shouldst not bear from me a Greekish member</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherein my sword had not impressure made</div>
                     <div class="line">Of our rank feud: but the just gods gainsay</div>
                     <div class="line">That any drop thou borrow'dst from thy mother,</div>
                     <div class="line">My sacred aunt, should by my mortal sword</div>
                     <div class="line">Be drain'd! Let me embrace thee, Ajax:</div>
                     <div class="line">By him that thunders, thou hast lusty arms;</div>
                     <div class="line">Hector would have them fall upon him thus:</div>
                     <div class="line">Cousin, all honour to thee!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AJAX</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank thee, Hector</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art too gentle and too free a man:</div>
                     <div class="line">I came to kill thee, cousin, and bear hence</div>
                     <div class="line">A great addition earned in thy death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HECTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Not Neoptolemus so mirable,</div>
                     <div class="line">On whose bright crest Fame with her loud'st Oyes</div>
                     <div class="line">Cries 'This is he,' could promise to himself</div>
                     <div class="line">A thought of added honour torn from Hector.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                     <div class="line">There is expectance here from both the sides,</div>
                     <div class="line">What further you will do.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HECTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll answer it;</div>
                     <div class="line">The issue is embracement: Ajax, farewell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AJAX</div>
                     <div class="line">If I might in entreaties find success--</div>
                     <div class="line">As seld I have the chance--I would desire</div>
                     <div class="line">My famous cousin to our Grecian tents.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIOMEDES</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis Agamemnon's wish, and great Achilles</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth long to see unarm'd the valiant Hector.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HECTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">AEneas, call my brother Troilus to me,</div>
                     <div class="line">And signify this loving interview</div>
                     <div class="line">To the expecters of our Trojan part;</div>
                     <div class="line">Desire them home. Give me thy hand, my cousin;</div>
                     <div class="line">I will go eat with thee and see your knights.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AJAX</div>
                     <div class="line">Great Agamemnon comes to meet us here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HECTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">The worthiest of them tell me name by name;</div>
                     <div class="line">But for Achilles, mine own searching eyes</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall find him by his large and portly size.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AGAMEMNON</div>
                     <div class="line">Worthy of arms! as welcome as to one</div>
                     <div class="line">That would be rid of such an enemy;</div>
                     <div class="line">But that's no welcome: understand more clear,</div>
                     <div class="line">What's past and what's to come is strew'd with husks</div>
                     <div class="line">And formless ruin of oblivion;</div>
                     <div class="line">But in this extant moment, faith and troth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Strain'd purely from all hollow bias-drawing,</div>
                     <div class="line">Bids thee, with most divine integrity,</div>
                     <div class="line">From heart of very heart, great Hector, welcome.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HECTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank thee, most imperious Agamemnon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AGAMEMNON</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>To TROILUS</span>  My well-famed lord of Troy, no</div>
                     <div class="line">less to you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENELAUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me confirm my princely brother's greeting:</div>
                     <div class="line">You brace of warlike brothers, welcome hither.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HECTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Who must we answer?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                     <div class="line">The noble Menelaus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HECTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">O, you, my lord? by Mars his gauntlet, thanks!</div>
                     <div class="line">Mock not, that I affect the untraded oath;</div>
                     <div class="line">Your quondam wife swears still by Venus' glove:</div>
                     <div class="line">She's well, but bade me not commend her to you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MENELAUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Name her not now, sir; she's a deadly theme.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HECTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">O, pardon; I offend.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NESTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">I have, thou gallant Trojan, seen thee oft</div>
                     <div class="line">Labouring for destiny make cruel way</div>
                     <div class="line">Through ranks of Greekish youth, and I have seen thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">As hot as Perseus, spur thy Phrygian steed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Despising many forfeits and subduements,</div>
                     <div class="line">When thou hast hung thy advanced sword i' the air,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not letting it decline on the declined,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I have said to some my standers by</div>
                     <div class="line">'Lo, Jupiter is yonder, dealing life!'</div>
                     <div class="line">And I have seen thee pause and take thy breath,</div>
                     <div class="line">When that a ring of Greeks have hemm'd thee in,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like an Olympian wrestling: this have I seen;</div>
