                     <p>Enter TROILUS</p>
                     <div class="line">How now, young man! mean'st thou to fight to-day?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANDROMACHE</div>
                     <div class="line">Cassandra, call my father to persuade.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit CASSANDRA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HECTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">No, faith, young Troilus; doff thy harness, youth;</div>
                     <div class="line">I am to-day i' the vein of chivalry:</div>
                     <div class="line">Let grow thy sinews till their knots be strong,</div>
                     <div class="line">And tempt not yet the brushes of the war.</div>
                     <div class="line">Unarm thee, go, and doubt thou not, brave boy,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll stand to-day for thee and me and Troy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Brother, you have a vice of mercy in you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which better fits a lion than a man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HECTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">What vice is that, good Troilus? chide me for it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">When many times the captive Grecian falls,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even in the fan and wind of your fair sword,</div>
                     <div class="line">You bid them rise, and live.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HECTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">O,'tis fair play.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Fool's play, by heaven, Hector.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HECTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">How now! how now!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">For the love of all the gods,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let's leave the hermit pity with our mothers,</div>
                     <div class="line">And when we have our armours buckled on,</div>
                     <div class="line">The venom'd vengeance ride upon our swords,</div>
                     <div class="line">Spur them to ruthful work, rein them from ruth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HECTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie, savage, fie!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Hector, then 'tis wars.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HECTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Troilus, I would not have you fight to-day.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Who should withhold me?</div>
                     <div class="line">Not fate, obedience, nor the hand of Mars</div>
                     <div class="line">Beckoning with fiery truncheon my retire;</div>
                     <div class="line">Not Priamus and Hecuba on knees,</div>
                     <div class="line">Their eyes o'ergalled with recourse of tears;</div>
                     <div class="line">Not you, my brother, with your true sword drawn,</div>
                     <div class="line">Opposed to hinder me, should stop my way,</div>
                     <div class="line">But by my ruin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter CASSANDRA, with PRIAM</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CASSANDRA</div>
                     <div class="line">Lay hold upon him, Priam, hold him fast:</div>
                     <div class="line">He is thy crutch; now if thou lose thy stay,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou on him leaning, and all Troy on thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Fall all together.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRIAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, Hector, come, go back:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy wife hath dream'd; thy mother hath had visions;</div>
                     <div class="line">Cassandra doth foresee; and I myself</div>
                     <div class="line">Am like a prophet suddenly enrapt</div>
                     <div class="line">To tell thee that this day is ominous:</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, come back.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HECTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">AEneas is a-field;</div>
                     <div class="line">And I do stand engaged to many Greeks,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even in the faith of valour, to appear</div>
                     <div class="line">This morning to them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRIAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, but thou shalt not go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HECTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">I must not break my faith.</div>
                     <div class="line">You know me dutiful; therefore, dear sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me not shame respect; but give me leave</div>
                     <div class="line">To take that course by your consent and voice,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which you do here forbid me, royal Priam.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CASSANDRA</div>
                     <div class="line">O Priam, yield not to him!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANDROMACHE</div>
                     <div class="line">Do not, dear father.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HECTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Andromache, I am offended with you:</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the love you bear me, get you in.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit ANDROMACHE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">This foolish, dreaming, superstitious girl</div>
                     <div class="line">Makes all these bodements.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CASSANDRA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, farewell, dear Hector!</div>
                     <div class="line">Look, how thou diest! look, how thy eye turns pale!</div>
                     <div class="line">Look, how thy wounds do bleed at many vents!</div>
                     <div class="line">Hark, how Troy roars! how Hecuba cries out!</div>
                     <div class="line">How poor Andromache shrills her dolours forth!</div>
                     <div class="line">Behold, distraction, frenzy and amazement,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like witless antics, one another meet,</div>
                     <div class="line">And all cry, Hector! Hector's dead! O Hector!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Away! away!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CASSANDRA</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell: yet, soft! Hector! take my leave:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou dost thyself and all our Troy deceive.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HECTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">You are amazed, my liege, at her exclaim:</div>
                     <div class="line">Go in and cheer the town: we'll forth and fight,</div>
                     <div class="line">Do deeds worth praise and tell you them at night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRIAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell: the gods with safety stand about thee!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt severally PRIAM and HECTOR. Alarums</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">They are at it, hark! Proud Diomed, believe,</div>
                     <div class="line">I come to lose my arm, or win my sleeve.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PANDARUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you hear, my lord? do you hear?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What now?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Here's a letter come from yond poor girl.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me read.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">A whoreson tisick, a whoreson rascally tisick so</div>
                     <div class="line">troubles me, and the foolish fortune of this girl;</div>
                     <div class="line">and what one thing, what another, that I shall</div>
                     <div class="line">leave you one o' these days: and I have a rheum</div>
                     <div class="line">in mine eyes too, and such an ache in my bones</div>
                     <div class="line">that, unless a man were cursed, I cannot tell what</div>
                     <div class="line">to think on't. What says she there?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Words, words, mere words, no matter from the heart:</div>
                     <div class="line">The effect doth operate another way.</div>
                     <p>Tearing the letter</p>
                     <div class="line">Go, wind, to wind, there turn and change together.</div>
                     <div class="line">My love with words and errors still she feeds;</div>
                     <div class="line">But edifies another with her deeds.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt severally</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.8.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Alarums: excursions. Enter THERSITES</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THERSITES</div>
                     <div class="line">Now they are clapper-clawing one another; I'll go</div>
                     <div class="line">look on. That dissembling abominable varlets Diomed,</div>
                     <div class="line">has got that same scurvy doting foolish young knave's</div>
                     <div class="line">sleeve of Troy there in his helm: I would fain see</div>
                     <div class="line">them meet; that that same young Trojan ass, that</div>
                     <div class="line">loves the whore there, might send that Greekish</div>
                     <div class="line">whore-masterly villain, with the sleeve, back to the</div>
                     <div class="line">dissembling luxurious drab, of a sleeveless errand.</div>
                     <div class="line">O' the t'other side, the policy of those crafty</div>
                     <div class="line">swearing rascals, that stale old mouse-eaten dry</div>
                     <div class="line">cheese, Nestor, and that same dog-fox, Ulysses, is</div>
                     <div class="line">not proved worthy a blackberry: they set me up, in</div>
                     <div class="line">policy, that mongrel cur, Ajax, against that dog of</div>
                     <div class="line">as bad a kind, Achilles: and now is the cur Ajax</div>
                     <div class="line">prouder than the cur Achilles, and will not arm</div>
                     <div class="line">to-day; whereupon the Grecians begin to proclaim</div>
                     <div class="line">barbarism, and policy grows into an ill opinion.</div>
                     <div class="line">Soft! here comes sleeve, and t'other.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter DIOMEDES, TROILUS following</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Fly not; for shouldst thou take the river Styx,</div>
                     <div class="line">I would swim after.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIOMEDES</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou dost miscall retire:</div>
                     <div class="line">I do not fly, but advantageous care</div>
                     <div class="line">Withdrew me from the odds of multitude:</div>
                     <div class="line">Have at thee!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THERSITES</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold thy whore, Grecian!--now for thy whore,</div>
                     <div class="line">Trojan!--now the sleeve, now the sleeve!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt TROILUS and DIOMEDES, fighting</p>
               <p>Enter HECTOR</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HECTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">What art thou, Greek? art thou for Hector's match?</div>
                     <div class="line">Art thou of blood and honour?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THERSITES</div>
                     <div class="line">No, no, I am a rascal; a scurvy railing knave:</div>
                     <div class="line">a very filthy rogue.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HECTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">I do believe thee: live.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THERSITES</div>
                     <div class="line">God-a-mercy, that thou wilt believe me; but a</div>
                     <div class="line">plague break thy neck for frightening me! What's</div>
                     <div class="line">become of the wenching rogues? I think they have</div>
                     <div class="line">swallowed one another: I would laugh at that</div>
                     <div class="line">miracle: yet, in a sort, lechery eats itself.</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll seek them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.8.6">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>5. SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter DIOMEDES and a Servant</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIOMEDES</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, go, my servant, take thou Troilus' horse;</div>
                     <div class="line">Present the fair steed to my lady Cressid:</div>
                     <div class="line">Fellow, commend my service to her beauty;</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell her I have chastised the amorous Trojan,</div>
                     <div class="line">And am her knight by proof.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">I go, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <p>Enter AGAMEMNON</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AGAMEMNON</div>
                     <div class="line">Renew, renew! The fierce Polydamas</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath beat down Menon: bastard Margarelon</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath Doreus prisoner,</div>
                     <div class="line">And stands colossus-wise, waving his beam,</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the pashed corses of the kings</div>
                     <div class="line">Epistrophus and Cedius: Polyxenes is slain,</div>
                     <div class="line">Amphimachus and Thoas deadly hurt,</div>
                     <div class="line">Patroclus ta'en or slain, and Palamedes</div>
                     <div class="line">Sore hurt and bruised: the dreadful Sagittary</div>
                     <div class="line">Appals our numbers: haste we, Diomed,</div>
                     <div class="line">To reinforcement, or we perish all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter NESTOR</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NESTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, bear Patroclus' body to Achilles;</div>
                     <div class="line">And bid the snail-paced Ajax arm for shame.</div>
                     <div class="line">There is a thousand Hectors in the field:</div>
                     <div class="line">Now here he fights on Galathe his horse,</div>
                     <div class="line">And there lacks work; anon he's there afoot,</div>
                     <div class="line">And there they fly or die, like scaled sculls</div>
                     <div class="line">Before the belching whale; then is he yonder,</div>
                     <div class="line">And there the strawy Greeks, ripe for his edge,</div>
                     <div class="line">Fall down before him, like the mower's swath:</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, there, and every where, he leaves and takes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Dexterity so obeying appetite</div>
                     <div class="line">That what he will he does, and does so much</div>
                     <div class="line">That proof is call'd impossibility.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ULYSSES</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ULYSSES</div>
                     <div class="line">O, courage, courage, princes! great Achilles</div>
                     <div class="line">Is arming, weeping, cursing, vowing vengeance:</div>
                     <div class="line">Patroclus' wounds have roused his drowsy blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Together with his mangled Myrmidons,</div>
                     <div class="line">That noseless, handless, hack'd and chipp'd, come to him,</div>
                     <div class="line">Crying on Hector. Ajax hath lost a friend</div>
                     <div class="line">And foams at mouth, and he is arm'd and at it,</div>
                     <div class="line">Roaring for Troilus, who hath done to-day</div>
                     <div class="line">Mad and fantastic execution,</div>
                     <div class="line">Engaging and redeeming of himself</div>
                     <div class="line">With such a careless force and forceless care</div>
                     <div class="line">As if that luck, in very spite of cunning,</div>
                     <div class="line">Bade him win all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter AJAX</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AJAX</div>
                     <div class="line">Troilus! thou coward Troilus!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIOMEDES</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, there, there.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NESTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">So, so, we draw together.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ACHILLES</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is this Hector?</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, come, thou boy-queller, show thy face;</div>
                     <div class="line">Know what it is to meet Achilles angry:</div>
                     <div class="line">Hector? where's Hector? I will none but Hector.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.8.7">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>6. SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter AJAX</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AJAX</div>
                     <div class="line">Troilus, thou coward Troilus, show thy head!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter DIOMEDES</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIOMEDES</div>
                     <div class="line">Troilus, I say! where's Troilus?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AJAX</div>
                     <div class="line">What wouldst thou?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIOMEDES</div>
                     <div class="line">I would correct him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AJAX</div>
                     <div class="line">Were I the general, thou shouldst have my office</div>
                     <div class="line">Ere that correction. Troilus, I say! what, Troilus!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter TROILUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">O traitor Diomed! turn thy false face, thou traitor,</div>
                     <div class="line">And pay thy life thou owest me for my horse!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIOMEDES</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha, art thou there?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AJAX</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll fight with him alone: stand, Diomed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIOMEDES</div>
                     <div class="line">He is my prize; I will not look upon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, both you cogging Greeks; have at you both!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt, fighting</p>
               <p>Enter HECTOR</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HECTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, Troilus? O, well fought, my youngest brother!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ACHILLES</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Now do I see thee, ha! have at thee, Hector!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HECTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Pause, if thou wilt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                     <div class="line">I do disdain thy courtesy, proud Trojan:</div>
                     <div class="line">Be happy that my arms are out of use:</div>
                     <div class="line">My rest and negligence befriends thee now,</div>
                     <div class="line">But thou anon shalt hear of me again;</div>
                     <div class="line">Till when, go seek thy fortune.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HECTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Fare thee well:</div>
                     <div class="line">I would have been much more a fresher man,</div>
                     <div class="line">Had I expected thee. How now, my brother!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter TROILUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ajax hath ta'en AEneas: shall it be?</div>
                     <div class="line">No, by the flame of yonder glorious heaven,</div>
                     <div class="line">He shall not carry him: I'll be ta'en too,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or bring him off: fate, hear me what I say!</div>
                     <div class="line">I reck not though I end my life to-day.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <p>Enter one in sumptuous armour</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HECTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Stand, stand, thou Greek; thou art a goodly mark:</div>
                     <div class="line">No? wilt thou not? I like thy armour well;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll frush it and unlock the rivets all,</div>
                     <div class="line">But I'll be master of it: wilt thou not,</div>
                     <div class="line">beast, abide?</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then fly on, I'll hunt thee for thy hide.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.8.8">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>7. SCENE VII.  Another part of the plains.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ACHILLES, with Myrmidons</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Come here about me, you my Myrmidons;</div>
                     <div class="line">Mark what I say. Attend me where I wheel:</div>
                     <div class="line">Strike not a stroke, but keep yourselves in breath:</div>
                     <div class="line">And when I have the bloody Hector found,</div>
                     <div class="line">Empale him with your weapons round about;</div>
                     <div class="line">In fellest manner execute your aims.</div>
                     <div class="line">Follow me, sirs, and my proceedings eye:</div>
                     <div class="line">It is decreed Hector the great must die.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
               <p>Enter MENELAUS and PARIS, fighting:
then THERSITES</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THERSITES</div>
                     <div class="line">The cuckold and the cuckold-maker are at it. Now,</div>
                     <div class="line">bull! now, dog! 'Loo, Paris, 'loo! now my double-</div>
                     <div class="line">henned sparrow! 'loo, Paris, 'loo! The bull has the</div>
                     <div class="line">game: ware horns, ho!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt PARIS and MENELAUS</p>
               <p>Enter MARGARELON</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARELON</div>
                     <div class="line">Turn, slave, and fight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THERSITES</div>
                     <div class="line">What art thou?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARELON</div>
                     <div class="line">A bastard son of Priam's.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THERSITES</div>
                     <div class="line">I am a bastard too; I love bastards: I am a bastard</div>
                     <div class="line">begot, bastard instructed, bastard in mind, bastard</div>
                     <div class="line">in valour, in every thing illegitimate. One bear will</div>
                     <div class="line">not bite another, and wherefore should one bastard?</div>
                     <div class="line">Take heed, the quarrel's most ominous to us: if the</div>
                     <div class="line">son of a whore fight for a whore, he tempts judgment:</div>
                     <div class="line">farewell, bastard.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARELON</div>
                     <div class="line">The devil take thee, coward!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.8.9">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>8. SCENE VIII.  Another part of the plains.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter HECTOR</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HECTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Most putrefied core, so fair without,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy goodly armour thus hath cost thy life.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now is my day's work done; I'll take good breath:</div>
                     <div class="line">Rest, sword; thou hast thy fill of blood and death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Puts off his helmet and hangs his shield
behind him</p>
               <p>Enter ACHILLES and Myrmidons</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Look, Hector, how the sun begins to set;</div>
                     <div class="line">How ugly night comes breathing at his heels:</div>
                     <div class="line">Even with the vail and darking of the sun,</div>
                     <div class="line">To close the day up, Hector's life is done.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HECTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">I am unarm'd; forego this vantage, Greek.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Strike, fellows, strike; this is the man I seek.</div>
                     <p>HECTOR falls</p>
                     <div class="line">So, Ilion, fall thou next! now, Troy, sink down!</div>
                     <div class="line">Here lies thy heart, thy sinews, and thy bone.</div>
                     <div class="line">On, Myrmidons, and cry you all amain,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Achilles hath the mighty Hector slain.'</div>
                     <p>A retreat sounded</p>
                     <div class="line">Hark! a retire upon our Grecian part.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MYRMIDONS</div>
                     <div class="line">The Trojan trumpets sound the like, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                     <div class="line">The dragon wing of night o'erspreads the earth,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, stickler-like, the armies separates.</div>
                     <div class="line">My half-supp'd sword, that frankly would have fed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Pleased with this dainty bait, thus goes to bed.</div>
                     <p>Sheathes his sword</p>
                     <div class="line">Come, tie his body to my horse's tail;</div>
                     <div class="line">Along the field I will the Trojan trail.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.8.10">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>9. SCENE IX.  Another part of the plains.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter AGAMEMNON, AJAX, MENELAUS, NESTOR, DIOMEDES,
and others, marching. Shouts within</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AGAMEMNON</div>
                     <div class="line">Hark! hark! what shout is that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NESTOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, drums!</div>
                     <p>Within</p>
                     <div class="line">Achilles! Achilles! Hector's slain! Achilles.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIOMEDES</div>
                     <div class="line">The bruit is, Hector's slain, and by Achilles.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AJAX</div>
                     <div class="line">If it be so, yet bragless let it be;</div>
                     <div class="line">Great Hector was a man as good as he.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AGAMEMNON</div>
                     <div class="line">March patiently along: let one be sent</div>
                     <div class="line">To pray Achilles see us at our tent.</div>
                     <div class="line">If in his death the gods have us befriended,</div>
                     <div class="line">Great Troy is ours, and our sharp wars are ended.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt, marching</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.8.11">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>10. SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter AENEAS and Trojans</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                     <div class="line">Stand, ho! yet are we masters of the field:</div>
                     <div class="line">Never go home; here starve we out the night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter TROILUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Hector is slain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALL</div>
                     <div class="line">Hector! the gods forbid!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">He's dead; and at the murderer's horse's tail,</div>
                     <div class="line">In beastly sort, dragg'd through the shameful field.</div>
                     <div class="line">Frown on, you heavens, effect your rage with speed!</div>
                     <div class="line">Sit, gods, upon your thrones, and smile at Troy!</div>
                     <div class="line">I say, at once let your brief plagues be mercy,</div>
                     <div class="line">And linger not our sure destructions on!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, you do discomfort all the host!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">You understand me not that tell me so:</div>
                     <div class="line">I do not speak of flight, of fear, of death,</div>
                     <div class="line">But dare all imminence that gods and men</div>
                     <div class="line">Address their dangers in. Hector is gone:</div>
                     <div class="line">Who shall tell Priam so, or Hecuba?</div>
                     <div class="line">Let him that will a screech-owl aye be call'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Go in to Troy, and say there, Hector's dead:</div>
                     <div class="line">There is a word will Priam turn to stone;</div>
                     <div class="line">Make wells and Niobes of the maids and wives,</div>
                     <div class="line">Cold statues of the youth, and, in a word,</div>
                     <div class="line">Scare Troy out of itself. But, march away:</div>
                     <div class="line">Hector is dead; there is no more to say.</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay yet. You vile abominable tents,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus proudly pight upon our Phrygian plains,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let Titan rise as early as he dare,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll through and through you! and, thou great-sized coward,</div>
                     <div class="line">No space of earth shall sunder our two hates:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll haunt thee like a wicked conscience still,</div>
                     <div class="line">That mouldeth goblins swift as frenzy's thoughts.</div>
                     <div class="line">Strike a free march to Troy! with comfort go:</div>
                     <div class="line">Hope of revenge shall hide our inward woe.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt AENEAS and Trojans</p>
               <p>As TROILUS is going out, enter, from the other
side, PANDARUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">But hear you, hear you!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Hence, broker-lackey! ignomy and shame</div>
                     <div class="line">Pursue thy life, and live aye with thy name!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                     <div class="line">A goodly medicine for my aching bones! O world!</div>
                     <div class="line">world! world! thus is the poor agent despised!</div>
                     <div class="line">O traitors and bawds, how earnestly are you set</div>
                     <div class="line">a-work, and how ill requited! why should our</div>
                     <div class="line">endeavour be so loved and the performance so loathed?</div>
                     <div class="line">what verse for it? what instance for it? Let me see:</div>
                     <div class="line">Full merrily the humble-bee doth sing,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till he hath lost his honey and his sting;</div>
                     <div class="line">And being once subdued in armed tail,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet honey and sweet notes together fail.</div>
                     <div class="line">Good traders in the flesh, set this in your</div>
                     <div class="line">painted cloths.</div>
                     <div class="line">As many as be here of pander's hall,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your eyes, half out, weep out at Pandar's fall;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or if you cannot weep, yet give some groans,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though not for me, yet for your aching bones.</div>
                     <div class="line">Brethren and sisters of the hold-door trade,</div>
                     <div class="line">Some two months hence my will shall here be made:</div>
                     <div class="line">It should be now, but that my fear is this,</div>
                     <div class="line">Some galled goose of Winchester would hiss:</div>
                     <div class="line">Till then I'll sweat and seek about for eases,</div>
                     <div class="line">And at that time bequeathe you my diseases.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
         </article>
      </article>
      <script src="../../resources/js/prism.js"/>
   </body>
</html>

      <title>The History of Troilus and Cressida</title>
   </head>

            <h1>The History of Troilus and Cressida</h1>
         </header>

         </div>
         <div class="content">
            <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
               <header class="preface-titlepage">
                  <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="content">
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">PRIAM, king of Troy.</span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">HECTOR</span>
                              <span class="personname">TROILUS</span>
                              <span class="personname">PARIS</span>
                              <span class="personname">DEIPHOBUS</span>
                              <span class="personname">HELENUS</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">his sons.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">MARGARELON, a bastard son of Priam.</span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">AENEAS</span>
                              <span class="personname">ANTENOR</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">Trojan commanders.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">CALCHAS, a Trojan priest, taking part with the Greeks.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">PANDARUS, uncle to Cressida.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">AGAMEMNON, the Grecian general.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">MENELAUS, his brother.</span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">ACHILLES</span>
                              <span class="personname">AJAX</span>
                              <span class="personname">ULYSSES</span>
                              <span class="personname">NESTOR</span>
                              <span class="personname">DIOMEDES</span>
                              <span class="personname">PATROCLUS</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">Grecian princes.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">THERSITES, a deformed and scurrilous Grecian.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">ALEXANDER, servant to Cressida.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Servant to Troilus. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Servant to Paris.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Servant to Diomedes. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">HELEN, wife to Menelaus.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">ANDROMACHE, wife to Hector.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">CASSANDRA, daughter to Priam, a prophetess.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">CRESSIDA, daughter to Calchas.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Trojan and Greek Soldiers, and Attendants.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>SCENE  Troy, and the Grecian camp before it.</p>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="preface" id="R.1.3">
               <header class="preface-titlepage">
                  <h2>PROLOGUE</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="content">
                  <div class="dialogue">
                     <div class="linegroup">
                        <div class="speaker"/>
                        <div class="line">In Troy, there lies the scene. From isles of Greece</div>
                        <div class="line">The princes orgulous, their high blood chafed,</div>
                        <div class="line">Have to the port of Athens sent their ships,</div>
                        <div class="line">Fraught with the ministers and instruments</div>
                        <div class="line">Of cruel war: sixty and nine, that wore</div>
                        <div class="line">Their crownets regal, from the Athenian bay</div>
                        <div class="line">Put forth toward Phrygia; and their vow is made</div>
                        <div class="line">To ransack Troy, within whose strong immures</div>
                        <div class="line">The ravish'd Helen, Menelaus' queen,</div>
                        <div class="line">With wanton Paris sleeps; and that's the quarrel.</div>
                        <div class="line">To Tenedos they come;</div>
                        <div class="line">And the deep-drawing barks do there disgorge</div>
                        <div class="line">Their warlike fraughtage: now on Dardan plains</div>
                        <div class="line">The fresh and yet unbruised Greeks do pitch</div>
                        <div class="line">Their brave pavilions: Priam's six-gated city,</div>
                        <div class="line">Dardan, and Tymbria, Helias, Chetas, Troien,</div>
                        <div class="line">And Antenorides, with massy staples</div>
                        <div class="line">And corresponsive and fulfilling bolts,</div>
                        <div class="line">Sperr up the sons of Troy.</div>
                        <div class="line">Now expectation, tickling skittish spirits,</div>
                        <div class="line">On one and other side, Trojan and Greek,</div>
                        <div class="line">Sets all on hazard: and hither am I come</div>
                        <div class="line">A prologue arm'd, but not in confidence</div>
                        <div class="line">Of author's pen or actor's voice, but suited</div>
                        <div class="line">In like conditions as our argument,</div>
                        <div class="line">To tell you, fair beholders, that our play</div>
                        <div class="line">Leaps o'er the vaunt and firstlings of those broils,</div>
                        <div class="line">Beginning in the middle, starting thence away</div>
                        <div class="line">To what may be digested in a play.</div>
                        <div class="line">Like or find fault; do as your pleasures are:</div>
                        <div class="line">Now good or bad, 'tis but the chance of war.</div>
                     </div>
                  </div>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.4">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>

                           </span>

                        <li>

                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.4">3. SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Agamemnon's tent.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.4.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter TROILUS armed, and PANDARUS</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Call here my varlet; I'll unarm again:</div>
                              <div class="line">Why should I war without the walls of Troy,</div>
                              <div class="line">That find such cruel battle here within?</div>
                              <div class="line">Each Trojan that is master of his heart,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let him to field; Troilus, alas! hath none.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Will this gear ne'er be mended?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">The Greeks are strong and skilful to their strength,</div>
                              <div class="line">Fierce to their skill and to their fierceness valiant;</div>
                              <div class="line">But I am weaker than a woman's tear,</div>
                              <div class="line">Tamer than sleep, fonder than ignorance,</div>
                              <div class="line">Less valiant than the virgin in the night</div>
                              <div class="line">And skilless as unpractised infancy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, I have told you enough of this: for my part,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll not meddle nor make no further. He that will</div>
                              <div class="line">have a cake out of the wheat must needs tarry the grinding.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Have I not tarried?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, the grinding; but you must tarry</div>
                              <div class="line">the bolting.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Have I not tarried?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, the bolting, but you must tarry the leavening.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Still have I tarried.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, to the leavening; but here's yet in the word</div>
                              <div class="line">'hereafter' the kneading, the making of the cake, the</div>
                              <div class="line">heating of the oven and the baking; nay, you must</div>
                              <div class="line">stay the cooling too, or you may chance to burn your lips.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Patience herself, what goddess e'er she be,</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth lesser blench at sufferance than I do.</div>
                              <div class="line">At Priam's royal table do I sit;</div>
                              <div class="line">And when fair Cressid comes into my thoughts,--</div>
                              <div class="line">So, traitor! 'When she comes!' When is she thence?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, she looked yesternight fairer than ever I saw</div>
                              <div class="line">her look, or any woman else.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I was about to tell thee:--when my heart,</div>
                              <div class="line">As wedged with a sigh, would rive in twain,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lest Hector or my father should perceive me,</div>
                              <div class="line">I have, as when the sun doth light a storm,</div>
                              <div class="line">Buried this sigh in wrinkle of a smile:</div>
                              <div class="line">But sorrow, that is couch'd in seeming gladness,</div>
                              <div class="line">Is like that mirth fate turns to sudden sadness.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">An her hair were not somewhat darker than Helen's--</div>
                              <div class="line">well, go to--there were no more comparison between</div>
                              <div class="line">the women: but, for my part, she is my kinswoman; I</div>
                              <div class="line">would not, as they term it, praise her: but I would</div>
                              <div class="line">somebody had heard her talk yesterday, as I did. I</div>
                              <div class="line">will not dispraise your sister Cassandra's wit, but--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">O Pandarus! I tell thee, Pandarus,--</div>
                              <div class="line">When I do tell thee, there my hopes lie drown'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">Reply not in how many fathoms deep</div>
                              <div class="line">They lie indrench'd. I tell thee I am mad</div>
                              <div class="line">In Cressid's love: thou answer'st 'she is fair;'</div>
                              <div class="line">Pour'st in the open ulcer of my heart</div>
                              <div class="line">Her eyes, her hair, her cheek, her gait, her voice,</div>
                              <div class="line">Handlest in thy discourse, O, that her hand,</div>
                              <div class="line">In whose comparison all whites are ink,</div>
                              <div class="line">Writing their own reproach, to whose soft seizure</div>
                              <div class="line">The cygnet's down is harsh and spirit of sense</div>
                              <div class="line">Hard as the palm of ploughman: this thou tell'st me,</div>
                              <div class="line">As true thou tell'st me, when I say I love her;</div>
                              <div class="line">But, saying thus, instead of oil and balm,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou lay'st in every gash that love hath given me</div>
                              <div class="line">The knife that made it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I speak no more than truth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou dost not speak so much.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Faith, I'll not meddle in't. Let her be as she is:</div>
                              <div class="line">if she be fair, 'tis the better for her; an she be</div>
                              <div class="line">not, she has the mends in her own hands.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Good Pandarus, how now, Pandarus!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I have had my labour for my travail; ill-thought on of</div>
                              <div class="line">her and ill-thought on of you; gone between and</div>
                              <div class="line">between, but small thanks for my labour.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">What, art thou angry, Pandarus? what, with me?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Because she's kin to me, therefore she's not so fair</div>
                              <div class="line">as Helen: an she were not kin to me, she would be as</div>
                              <div class="line">fair on Friday as Helen is on Sunday. But what care</div>
                              <div class="line">I? I care not an she were a black-a-moor; 'tis all one to me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Say I she is not fair?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I do not care whether you do or no. She's a fool to</div>
                              <div class="line">stay behind her father; let her to the Greeks; and so</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll tell her the next time I see her: for my part,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll meddle nor make no more i' the matter.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Pandarus,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Not I.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet Pandarus,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Pray you, speak no more to me: I will leave all as I</div>
                              <div class="line">found it, and there an end.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit PANDARUS. An alarum</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Peace, you ungracious clamours! peace, rude sounds!</div>
                              <div class="line">Fools on both sides! Helen must needs be fair,</div>
                              <div class="line">When with your blood you daily paint her thus.</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot fight upon this argument;</div>
                              <div class="line">It is too starved a subject for my sword.</div>
                              <div class="line">But Pandarus,--O gods, how do you plague me!</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot come to Cressid but by Pandar;</div>
                              <div class="line">And he's as tetchy to be woo'd to woo.</div>
                              <div class="line">As she is stubborn-chaste against all suit.</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell me, Apollo, for thy Daphne's love,</div>
                              <div class="line">What Cressid is, what Pandar, and what we?</div>
                              <div class="line">Her bed is India; there she lies, a pearl:</div>
                              <div class="line">Between our Ilium and where she resides,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let it be call'd the wild and wandering flood,</div>
                              <div class="line">Ourself the merchant, and this sailing Pandar</div>
                              <div class="line">Our doubtful hope, our convoy and our bark.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Alarum. Enter AENEAS</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                              <div class="line">How now, Prince Troilus! wherefore not afield?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Because not there: this woman's answer sorts,</div>
                              <div class="line">For womanish it is to be from thence.</div>
                              <div class="line">What news, AEneas, from the field to-day?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                              <div class="line">That Paris is returned home and hurt.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">By whom, AEneas?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                              <div class="line">Troilus, by Menelaus.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Let Paris bleed; 'tis but a scar to scorn;</div>
                              <div class="line">Paris is gored with Menelaus' horn.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Alarum</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                              <div class="line">Hark, what good sport is out of town to-day!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Better at home, if 'would I might' were 'may.'</div>
                              <div class="line">But to the sport abroad: are you bound thither?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AENEAS</div>
                              <div class="line">In all swift haste.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, go we then together.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.4.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  The Same. A street.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter CRESSIDA and ALEXANDER</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Who were those went by?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALEXANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">Queen Hecuba and Helen.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">And whither go they?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
