                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALEXANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">Up to the eastern tower,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose height commands as subject all the vale,</div>
                              <div class="line">To see the battle. Hector, whose patience</div>
                              <div class="line">Is, as a virtue, fix'd, to-day was moved:</div>
                              <div class="line">He chid Andromache and struck his armourer,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, like as there were husbandry in war,</div>
                              <div class="line">Before the sun rose he was harness'd light,</div>
                              <div class="line">And to the field goes he; where every flower</div>
                              <div class="line">Did, as a prophet, weep what it foresaw</div>
                              <div class="line">In Hector's wrath.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">What was his cause of anger?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALEXANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">The noise goes, this: there is among the Greeks</div>
                              <div class="line">A lord of Trojan blood, nephew to Hector;</div>
                              <div class="line">They call him Ajax.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Good; and what of him?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALEXANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">They say he is a very man per se,</div>
                              <div class="line">And stands alone.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">So do all men, unless they are drunk, sick, or have no legs.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALEXANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">This man, lady, hath robbed many beasts of their</div>
                              <div class="line">particular additions; he is as valiant as the lion,</div>
                              <div class="line">churlish as the bear, slow as the elephant: a man</div>
                              <div class="line">into whom nature hath so crowded humours that his</div>
                              <div class="line">valour is crushed into folly, his folly sauced with</div>
                              <div class="line">discretion: there is no man hath a virtue that he</div>
                              <div class="line">hath not a glimpse of, nor any man an attaint but he</div>
                              <div class="line">carries some stain of it: he is melancholy without</div>
                              <div class="line">cause, and merry against the hair: he hath the</div>
                              <div class="line">joints of every thing, but everything so out of joint</div>
                              <div class="line">that he is a gouty Briareus, many hands and no use,</div>
                              <div class="line">or purblind Argus, all eyes and no sight.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">But how should this man, that makes</div>
                              <div class="line">me smile, make Hector angry?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALEXANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">They say he yesterday coped Hector in the battle and</div>
                              <div class="line">struck him down, the disdain and shame whereof hath</div>
                              <div class="line">ever since kept Hector fasting and waking.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Who comes here?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALEXANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, your uncle Pandarus.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter PANDARUS</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Hector's a gallant man.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALEXANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">As may be in the world, lady.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">What's that? what's that?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Good morrow, uncle Pandarus.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Good morrow, cousin Cressid: what do you talk of?</div>
                              <div class="line">Good morrow, Alexander. How do you, cousin? When</div>
                              <div class="line">were you at Ilium?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">This morning, uncle.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">What were you talking of when I came? Was Hector</div>
                              <div class="line">armed and gone ere ye came to Ilium? Helen was not</div>
                              <div class="line">up, was she?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Hector was gone, but Helen was not up.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Even so: Hector was stirring early.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">That were we talking of, and of his anger.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Was he angry?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">So he says here.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">True, he was so: I know the cause too: he'll lay</div>
                              <div class="line">about him to-day, I can tell them that: and there's</div>
                              <div class="line">Troilus will not come far behind him: let them take</div>
                              <div class="line">heed of Troilus, I can tell them that too.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">What, is he angry too?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Who, Troilus? Troilus is the better man of the two.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">O Jupiter! there's no comparison.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">What, not between Troilus and Hector? Do you know a</div>
                              <div class="line">man if you see him?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, if I ever saw him before and knew him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, I say Troilus is Troilus.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Then you say as I say; for, I am sure, he is not Hector.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">No, nor Hector is not Troilus in some degrees.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis just to each of them; he is himself.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Himself! Alas, poor Troilus! I would he were.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">So he is.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Condition, I had gone barefoot to India.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">He is not Hector.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Himself! no, he's not himself: would a' were</div>
                              <div class="line">himself! Well, the gods are above; time must friend</div>
                              <div class="line">or end: well, Troilus, well: I would my heart were</div>
                              <div class="line">in her body. No, Hector is not a better man than Troilus.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Excuse me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">He is elder.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Pardon me, pardon me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Th' other's not come to't; you shall tell me another</div>
                              <div class="line">tale, when th' other's come to't. Hector shall not</div>
                              <div class="line">have his wit this year.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">He shall not need it, if he have his own.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor his qualities.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">No matter.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor his beauty.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">'Twould not become him; his own's better.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">You have no judgment, niece: Helen</div>
                              <div class="line">herself swore th' other day, that Troilus, for</div>
                              <div class="line">a brown favour--for so 'tis, I must confess,--</div>
                              <div class="line">not brown neither,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">No, but brown.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">'Faith, to say truth, brown and not brown.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">To say the truth, true and not true.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">She praised his complexion above Paris.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, Paris hath colour enough.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">So he has.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Then Troilus should have too much: if she praised</div>
                              <div class="line">him above, his complexion is higher than his; he</div>
                              <div class="line">having colour enough, and the other higher, is too</div>
                              <div class="line">flaming a praise for a good complexion. I had as</div>
                              <div class="line">lief Helen's golden tongue had commended Troilus for</div>
                              <div class="line">a copper nose.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I swear to you. I think Helen loves him better than Paris.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Then she's a merry Greek indeed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, I am sure she does. She came to him th' other</div>
                              <div class="line">day into the compassed window,--and, you know, he</div>
                              <div class="line">has not past three or four hairs on his chin,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Indeed, a tapster's arithmetic may soon bring his</div>
                              <div class="line">particulars therein to a total.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, he is very young: and yet will he, within</div>
                              <div class="line">three pound, lift as much as his brother Hector.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Is he so young a man and so old a lifter?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">But to prove to you that Helen loves him: she came</div>
                              <div class="line">and puts me her white hand to his cloven chin--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Juno have mercy! how came it cloven?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, you know 'tis dimpled: I think his smiling</div>
                              <div class="line">becomes him better than any man in all Phrygia.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">O, he smiles valiantly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Does he not?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">O yes, an 'twere a cloud in autumn.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, go to, then: but to prove to you that Helen</div>
                              <div class="line">loves Troilus,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Troilus will stand to the proof, if you'll</div>
                              <div class="line">prove it so.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Troilus! why, he esteems her no more than I esteem</div>
                              <div class="line">an addle egg.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">If you love an addle egg as well as you love an idle</div>
                              <div class="line">head, you would eat chickens i' the shell.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot choose but laugh, to think how she tickled</div>
                              <div class="line">his chin: indeed, she has a marvellous white hand, I</div>
                              <div class="line">must needs confess,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Without the rack.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">And she takes upon her to spy a white hair on his chin.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas, poor chin! many a wart is richer.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">But there was such laughing! Queen Hecuba laughed</div>
                              <div class="line">that her eyes ran o'er.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">With mill-stones.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">And Cassandra laughed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">But there was more temperate fire under the pot of</div>
                              <div class="line">her eyes: did her eyes run o'er too?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">And Hector laughed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">At what was all this laughing?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, at the white hair that Helen spied on Troilus' chin.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">An't had been a green hair, I should have laughed</div>
                              <div class="line">too.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">They laughed not so much at the hair as at his pretty answer.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">What was his answer?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Quoth she, 'Here's but two and fifty hairs on your</div>
                              <div class="line">chin, and one of them is white.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">This is her question.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">That's true; make no question of that. 'Two and</div>
                              <div class="line">fifty hairs' quoth he, 'and one white: that white</div>
                              <div class="line">hair is my father, and all the rest are his sons.'</div>
                              <div class="line">'Jupiter!' quoth she, 'which of these hairs is Paris,</div>
                              <div class="line">my husband? 'The forked one,' quoth he, 'pluck't</div>
                              <div class="line">out, and give it him.' But there was such laughing!</div>
                              <div class="line">and Helen so blushed, an Paris so chafed, and all the</div>
                              <div class="line">rest so laughed, that it passed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">So let it now; for it has been while going by.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, cousin. I told you a thing yesterday; think on't.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">So I do.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll be sworn 'tis true; he will weep you, an 'twere</div>
                              <div class="line">a man born in April.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">And I'll spring up in his tears, an 'twere a nettle</div>
                              <div class="line">against May.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>A retreat sounded</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Hark! they are coming from the field: shall we</div>
                              <div class="line">stand up here, and see them as they pass toward</div>
                              <div class="line">Ilium? good niece, do, sweet niece Cressida.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">At your pleasure.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Here, here, here's an excellent place; here we may</div>
                              <div class="line">see most bravely: I'll tell you them all by their</div>
                              <div class="line">names as they pass by; but mark Troilus above the rest.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak not so loud.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>AENEAS passes</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">That's AEneas: is not that a brave man? he's one of</div>
                              <div class="line">the flowers of Troy, I can tell you: but mark</div>
                              <div class="line">Troilus; you shall see anon.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>ANTENOR passes</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Who's that?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">That's Antenor: he has a shrewd wit, I can tell you;</div>
                              <div class="line">and he's a man good enough, he's one o' the soundest</div>
                              <div class="line">judgments in whosoever, and a proper man of person.</div>
                              <div class="line">When comes Troilus? I'll show you Troilus anon: if</div>
                              <div class="line">he see me, you shall see him nod at me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Will he give you the nod?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">You shall see.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">If he do, the rich shall have more.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>HECTOR passes</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">That's Hector, that, that, look you, that; there's a</div>
                              <div class="line">fellow! Go thy way, Hector! There's a brave man,</div>
                              <div class="line">niece. O brave Hector! Look how he looks! there's</div>
                              <div class="line">a countenance! is't not a brave man?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">O, a brave man!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Is a' not? it does a man's heart good. Look you</div>
                              <div class="line">what hacks are on his helmet! look you yonder, do</div>
                              <div class="line">you see? look you there: there's no jesting;</div>
                              <div class="line">there's laying on, take't off who will, as they say:</div>
                              <div class="line">there be hacks!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Be those with swords?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Swords! any thing, he cares not; an the devil come</div>
                              <div class="line">to him, it's all one: by God's lid, it does one's</div>
                              <div class="line">heart good. Yonder comes Paris, yonder comes Paris.</div>
                              <p>PARIS passes</p>
                              <div class="line">Look ye yonder, niece; is't not a gallant man too,</div>
                              <div class="line">is't not? Why, this is brave now. Who said he came</div>
                              <div class="line">hurt home to-day? he's not hurt: why, this will do</div>
                              <div class="line">Helen's heart good now, ha! Would I could see</div>
                              <div class="line">Troilus now! You shall see Troilus anon.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>HELENUS passes</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Who's that?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">That's Helenus. I marvel where Troilus is. That's</div>
                              <div class="line">Helenus. I think he went not forth to-day. That's Helenus.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Can Helenus fight, uncle?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Helenus? no. Yes, he'll fight indifferent well. I</div>
                              <div class="line">marvel where Troilus is. Hark! do you not hear the</div>
                              <div class="line">people cry 'Troilus'? Helenus is a priest.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">What sneaking fellow comes yonder?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>TROILUS passes</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Where? yonder? that's Deiphobus. 'Tis Troilus!</div>
                              <div class="line">there's a man, niece! Hem! Brave Troilus! the</div>
                              <div class="line">prince of chivalry!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Peace, for shame, peace!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Mark him; note him. O brave Troilus! Look well upon</div>
                              <div class="line">him, niece: look you how his sword is bloodied, and</div>
                              <div class="line">his helm more hacked than Hector's, and how he looks,</div>
                              <div class="line">and how he goes! O admirable youth! he ne'er saw</div>
                              <div class="line">three and twenty. Go thy way, Troilus, go thy way!</div>
                              <div class="line">Had I a sister were a grace, or a daughter a goddess,</div>
                              <div class="line">he should take his choice. O admirable man! Paris?</div>
                              <div class="line">Paris is dirt to him; and, I warrant, Helen, to</div>
                              <div class="line">change, would give an eye to boot.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Here come more.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Forces pass</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Asses, fools, dolts! chaff and bran, chaff and bran!</div>
                              <div class="line">porridge after meat! I could live and die i' the</div>
                              <div class="line">eyes of Troilus. Ne'er look, ne'er look: the eagles</div>
                              <div class="line">are gone: crows and daws, crows and daws! I had</div>
                              <div class="line">rather be such a man as Troilus than Agamemnon and</div>
                              <div class="line">all Greece.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">There is among the Greeks Achilles, a better man than Troilus.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Achilles! a drayman, a porter, a very camel.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, well.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">'Well, well!' why, have you any discretion? have</div>
                              <div class="line">you any eyes? Do you know what a man is? Is not</div>
                              <div class="line">birth, beauty, good shape, discourse, manhood,</div>
                              <div class="line">learning, gentleness, virtue, youth, liberality,</div>
                              <div class="line">and such like, the spice and salt that season a man?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, a minced man: and then to be baked with no date</div>
                              <div class="line">in the pie, for then the man's date's out.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">You are such a woman! one knows not at what ward you</div>
                              <div class="line">lie.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon my back, to defend my belly; upon my wit, to</div>
                              <div class="line">defend my wiles; upon my secrecy, to defend mine</div>
                              <div class="line">honesty; my mask, to defend my beauty; and you, to</div>
                              <div class="line">defend all these: and at all these wards I lie, at a</div>
                              <div class="line">thousand watches.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Say one of your watches.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, I'll watch you for that; and that's one of the</div>
                              <div class="line">chiefest of them too: if I cannot ward what I would</div>
                              <div class="line">not have hit, I can watch you for telling how I took</div>
                              <div class="line">the blow; unless it swell past hiding, and then it's</div>
                              <div class="line">past watching.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">You are such another!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter Troilus's Boy</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Boy</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, my lord would instantly speak with you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Where?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Boy</div>
                              <div class="line">At your own house; there he unarms him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Good boy, tell him I come.</div>
                              <p>Exit boy</p>
                              <div class="line">I doubt he be hurt. Fare ye well, good niece.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Adieu, uncle.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll be with you, niece, by and by.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">To bring, uncle?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, a token from Troilus.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">By the same token, you are a bawd.</div>
                              <p>Exit PANDARUS</p>
                              <div class="line">Words, vows, gifts, tears, and love's full sacrifice,</div>
                              <div class="line">He offers in another's enterprise;</div>
                              <div class="line">But more in Troilus thousand fold I see</div>
                              <div class="line">Than in the glass of Pandar's praise may be;</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet hold I off. Women are angels, wooing:</div>
                              <div class="line">Things won are done; joy's soul lies in the doing.</div>
                              <div class="line">That she beloved knows nought that knows not this:</div>
                              <div class="line">Men prize the thing ungain'd more than it is:</div>
                              <div class="line">That she was never yet that ever knew</div>
                              <div class="line">Love got so sweet as when desire did sue.</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore this maxim out of love I teach:</div>
                              <div class="line">Achievement is command; ungain'd, beseech:</div>
                              <div class="line">Then though my heart's content firm love doth bear,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nothing of that shall from mine eyes appear.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.4.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Agamemnon's tent.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Sennet. Enter AGAMEMNON, NESTOR, ULYSSES,
MENELAUS, and others</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AGAMEMNON</div>
                              <div class="line">Princes,</div>
                              <div class="line">What grief hath set the jaundice on your cheeks?</div>
                              <div class="line">The ample proposition that hope makes</div>
                              <div class="line">In all designs begun on earth below</div>
                              <div class="line">Fails in the promised largeness: cheques and disasters</div>
                              <div class="line">Grow in the veins of actions highest rear'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">As knots, by the conflux of meeting sap,</div>
                              <div class="line">Infect the sound pine and divert his grain</div>
                              <div class="line">Tortive and errant from his course of growth.</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor, princes, is it matter new to us</div>
                              <div class="line">That we come short of our suppose so far</div>
                              <div class="line">That after seven years' siege yet Troy walls stand;</div>
                              <div class="line">Sith every action that hath gone before,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whereof we have record, trial did draw</div>
                              <div class="line">Bias and thwart, not answering the aim,</div>
                              <div class="line">And that unbodied figure of the thought</div>
                              <div class="line">That gave't surmised shape. Why then, you princes,</div>
                              <div class="line">Do you with cheeks abash'd behold our works,</div>
                              <div class="line">And call them shames? which are indeed nought else</div>
                              <div class="line">But the protractive trials of great Jove</div>
                              <div class="line">To find persistive constancy in men:</div>
                              <div class="line">The fineness of which metal is not found</div>
                              <div class="line">In fortune's love; for then the bold and coward,</div>
                              <div class="line">The wise and fool, the artist and unread,</div>
                              <div class="line">The hard and soft seem all affined and kin:</div>
                              <div class="line">But, in the wind and tempest of her frown,</div>
                              <div class="line">Distinction, with a broad and powerful fan,</div>
                              <div class="line">Puffing at all, winnows the light away;</div>
                              <div class="line">And what hath mass or matter, by itself</div>
                              <div class="line">Lies rich in virtue and unmingled.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NESTOR</div>
                              <div class="line">With due observance of thy godlike seat,</div>
                              <div class="line">Great Agamemnon, Nestor shall apply</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy latest words. In the reproof of chance</div>
                              <div class="line">Lies the true proof of men: the sea being smooth,</div>
                              <div class="line">How many shallow bauble boats dare sail</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon her patient breast, making their way</div>
                              <div class="line">With those of nobler bulk!</div>
                              <div class="line">But let the ruffian Boreas once enrage</div>
                              <div class="line">The gentle Thetis, and anon behold</div>
                              <div class="line">The strong-ribb'd bark through liquid mountains cut,</div>
                              <div class="line">Bounding between the two moist elements,</div>
                              <div class="line">Like Perseus' horse: where's then the saucy boat</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose weak untimber'd sides but even now</div>
                              <div class="line">Co-rivall'd greatness? Either to harbour fled,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or made a toast for Neptune. Even so</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth valour's show and valour's worth divide</div>
                              <div class="line">In storms of fortune; for in her ray and brightness</div>
                              <div class="line">The herd hath more annoyance by the breeze</div>
                              <div class="line">Than by the tiger; but when the splitting wind</div>
                              <div class="line">Makes flexible the knees of knotted oaks,</div>
                              <div class="line">And flies fled under shade, why, then the thing of courage</div>
                              <div class="line">As roused with rage with rage doth sympathize,</div>
                              <div class="line">And with an accent tuned in selfsame key</div>
                              <div class="line">Retorts to chiding fortune.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ULYSSES</div>
                              <div class="line">Agamemnon,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou great commander, nerve and bone of Greece,</div>
                              <div class="line">Heart of our numbers, soul and only spirit.</div>
                              <div class="line">In whom the tempers and the minds of all</div>
                              <div class="line">Should be shut up, hear what Ulysses speaks.</div>
                              <div class="line">Besides the applause and approbation To which,</div>
                              <p>To AGAMEMNON</p>
                              <div class="line">most mighty for thy place and sway,</div>
                              <p>To NESTOR</p>
                              <div class="line">And thou most reverend for thy stretch'd-out life</div>
                              <div class="line">I give to both your speeches, which were such</div>
                              <div class="line">As Agamemnon and the hand of Greece</div>
                              <div class="line">Should hold up high in brass, and such again</div>
                              <div class="line">As venerable Nestor, hatch'd in silver,</div>
                              <div class="line">Should with a bond of air, strong as the axle-tree</div>
                              <div class="line">On which heaven rides, knit all the Greekish ears</div>
                              <div class="line">To his experienced tongue, yet let it please both,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou great, and wise, to hear Ulysses speak.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AGAMEMNON</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak, prince of Ithaca; and be't of less expect</div>
                              <div class="line">That matter needless, of importless burden,</div>
                              <div class="line">Divide thy lips, than we are confident,</div>
                              <div class="line">When rank Thersites opes his mastic jaws,</div>
                              <div class="line">We shall hear music, wit and oracle.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ULYSSES</div>
                              <div class="line">Troy, yet upon his basis, had been down,</div>
                              <div class="line">And the great Hector's sword had lack'd a master,</div>
                              <div class="line">But for these instances.</div>
                              <div class="line">The specialty of rule hath been neglected:</div>
                              <div class="line">And, look, how many Grecian tents do stand</div>
                              <div class="line">Hollow upon this plain, so many hollow factions.</div>
                              <div class="line">When that the general is not like the hive</div>
                              <div class="line">To whom the foragers shall all repair,</div>
                              <div class="line">What honey is expected? Degree being vizarded,</div>
                              <div class="line">The unworthiest shows as fairly in the mask.</div>
                              <div class="line">The heavens themselves, the planets and this centre</div>
                              <div class="line">Observe degree, priority and place,</div>
                              <div class="line">Insisture, course, proportion, season, form,</div>
                              <div class="line">Office and custom, in all line of order;</div>
                              <div class="line">And therefore is the glorious planet Sol</div>
                              <div class="line">In noble eminence enthroned and sphered</div>
                              <div class="line">Amidst the other; whose medicinable eye</div>
                              <div class="line">Corrects the ill aspects of planets evil,</div>
                              <div class="line">And posts, like the commandment of a king,</div>
                              <div class="line">Sans cheque to good and bad: but when the planets</div>
                              <div class="line">In evil mixture to disorder wander,</div>
                              <div class="line">What plagues and what portents! what mutiny!</div>
                              <div class="line">What raging of the sea! shaking of earth!</div>
                              <div class="line">Commotion in the winds! frights, changes, horrors,</div>
                              <div class="line">Divert and crack, rend and deracinate</div>
                              <div class="line">The unity and married calm of states</div>
                              <div class="line">Quite from their fixure! O, when degree is shaked,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which is the ladder to all high designs,</div>
                              <div class="line">Then enterprise is sick! How could communities,</div>
                              <div class="line">Degrees in schools and brotherhoods in cities,</div>
                              <div class="line">Peaceful commerce from dividable shores,</div>
                              <div class="line">The primogenitive and due of birth,</div>
                              <div class="line">Prerogative of age, crowns, sceptres, laurels,</div>
                              <div class="line">But by degree, stand in authentic place?</div>
                              <div class="line">Take but degree away, untune that string,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, hark, what discord follows! each thing meets</div>
                              <div class="line">In mere oppugnancy: the bounded waters</div>
                              <div class="line">Should lift their bosoms higher than the shores</div>
                              <div class="line">And make a sop of all this solid globe:</div>
                              <div class="line">Strength should be lord of imbecility,</div>
                              <div class="line">And the rude son should strike his father dead:</div>
                              <div class="line">Force should be right; or rather, right and wrong,</div>
                              <div class="line">Between whose endless jar justice resides,</div>
                              <div class="line">Should lose their names, and so should justice too.</div>
                              <div class="line">Then every thing includes itself in power,</div>
                              <div class="line">Power into will, will into appetite;</div>
                              <div class="line">And appetite, an universal wolf,</div>
                              <div class="line">So doubly seconded with will and power,</div>
                              <div class="line">Must make perforce an universal prey,</div>
                              <div class="line">And last eat up himself. Great Agamemnon,</div>
                              <div class="line">This chaos, when degree is suffocate,</div>
                              <div class="line">Follows the choking.</div>
                              <div class="line">And this neglection of degree it is</div>
                              <div class="line">That by a pace goes backward, with a purpose</div>
                              <div class="line">It hath to climb. The general's disdain'd</div>
                              <div class="line">By him one step below, he by the next,</div>
                              <div class="line">That next by him beneath; so every step,</div>
                              <div class="line">Exampled by the first pace that is sick</div>
                              <div class="line">Of his superior, grows to an envious fever</div>
                              <div class="line">Of pale and bloodless emulation:</div>
                              <div class="line">And 'tis this fever that keeps Troy on foot,</div>
                              <div class="line">Not her own sinews. To end a tale of length,</div>
                              <div class="line">Troy in our weakness stands, not in her strength.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NESTOR</div>
                              <div class="line">Most wisely hath Ulysses here discover'd</div>
                              <div class="line">The fever whereof all our power is sick.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AGAMEMNON</div>
                              <div class="line">The nature of the sickness found, Ulysses,</div>
                              <div class="line">What is the remedy?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ULYSSES</div>
                              <div class="line">The great Achilles, whom opinion crowns</div>
                              <div class="line">The sinew and the forehand of our host,</div>
                              <div class="line">Having his ear full of his airy fame,</div>
                              <div class="line">Grows dainty of his worth, and in his tent</div>
                              <div class="line">Lies mocking our designs: with him Patroclus</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon a lazy bed the livelong day</div>
                              <div class="line">Breaks scurril jests;</div>
                              <div class="line">And with ridiculous and awkward action,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which, slanderer, he imitation calls,</div>
                              <div class="line">He pageants us. Sometime, great Agamemnon,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy topless deputation he puts on,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, like a strutting player, whose conceit</div>
                              <div class="line">Lies in his hamstring, and doth think it rich</div>
                              <div class="line">To hear the wooden dialogue and sound</div>
                              <div class="line">'Twixt his stretch'd footing and the scaffoldage,--</div>
                              <div class="line">Such to-be-pitied and o'er-wrested seeming</div>
                              <div class="line">He acts thy greatness in: and when he speaks,</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis like a chime a-mending; with terms unsquared,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which, from the tongue of roaring Typhon dropp'd</div>
                              <div class="line">Would seem hyperboles. At this fusty stuff</div>
                              <div class="line">The large Achilles, on his press'd bed lolling,</div>
                              <div class="line">From his deep chest laughs out a loud applause;</div>
                              <div class="line">Cries 'Excellent! 'tis Agamemnon just.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now play me Nestor; hem, and stroke thy beard,</div>
                              <div class="line">As he being drest to some oration.'</div>
                              <div class="line">That's done, as near as the extremest ends</div>
                              <div class="line">Of parallels, as like as Vulcan and his wife:</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet god Achilles still cries 'Excellent!</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis Nestor right. Now play him me, Patroclus,</div>
                              <div class="line">Arming to answer in a night alarm.'</div>
                              <div class="line">And then, forsooth, the faint defects of age</div>
                              <div class="line">Must be the scene of mirth; to cough and spit,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, with a palsy-fumbling on his gorget,</div>
                              <div class="line">Shake in and out the rivet: and at this sport</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir Valour dies; cries 'O, enough, Patroclus;</div>
                              <div class="line">Or give me ribs of steel! I shall split all</div>
                              <div class="line">In pleasure of my spleen.' And in this fashion,</div>
                              <div class="line">All our abilities, gifts, natures, shapes,</div>
                              <div class="line">Severals and generals of grace exact,</div>
                              <div class="line">Achievements, plots, orders, preventions,</div>
                              <div class="line">Excitements to the field, or speech for truce,</div>
                              <div class="line">Success or loss, what is or is not, serves</div>
                              <div class="line">As stuff for these two to make paradoxes.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NESTOR</div>
                              <div class="line">And in the imitation of these twain--</div>
                              <div class="line">Who, as Ulysses says, opinion crowns</div>
                              <div class="line">With an imperial voice--many are infect.</div>
                              <div class="line">Ajax is grown self-will'd, and bears his head</div>
                              <div class="line">In such a rein, in full as proud a place</div>
                              <div class="line">As broad Achilles; keeps his tent like him;</div>
                              <div class="line">Makes factious feasts; rails on our state of war,</div>
                              <div class="line">Bold as an oracle, and sets Thersites,</div>
                              <div class="line">A slave whose gall coins slanders like a mint,</div>
                              <div class="line">To match us in comparisons with dirt,</div>
                              <div class="line">To weaken and discredit our exposure,</div>
                              <div class="line">How rank soever rounded in with danger.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ULYSSES</div>
                              <div class="line">They tax our policy, and call it cowardice,</div>
