                              <div class="line">Let thy song be love: this love will undo us all.</div>
                              <div class="line">O Cupid, Cupid, Cupid!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Love! ay, that it shall, i' faith.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, good now, love, love, nothing but love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">In good troth, it begins so.</div>
                              <p>Sings</p>
                              <div class="line">Love, love, nothing but love, still more!</div>
                              <div class="line">For, O, love's bow</div>
                              <div class="line">Shoots buck and doe:</div>
                              <div class="line">The shaft confounds,</div>
                              <div class="line">Not that it wounds,</div>
                              <div class="line">But tickles still the sore.</div>
                              <div class="line">These lovers cry Oh! oh! they die!</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet that which seems the wound to kill,</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth turn oh! oh! to ha! ha! he!</div>
                              <div class="line">So dying love lives still:</div>
                              <div class="line">Oh! oh! a while, but ha! ha! ha!</div>
                              <div class="line">Oh! oh! groans out for ha! ha! ha!</div>
                              <div class="line">Heigh-ho!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELEN</div>
                              <div class="line">In love, i' faith, to the very tip of the nose.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                              <div class="line">He eats nothing but doves, love, and that breeds hot</div>
                              <div class="line">blood, and hot blood begets hot thoughts, and hot</div>
                              <div class="line">thoughts beget hot deeds, and hot deeds is love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Is this the generation of love? hot blood, hot</div>
                              <div class="line">thoughts, and hot deeds? Why, they are vipers:</div>
                              <div class="line">is love a generation of vipers? Sweet lord, who's</div>
                              <div class="line">a-field to-day?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                              <div class="line">Hector, Deiphobus, Helenus, Antenor, and all the</div>
                              <div class="line">gallantry of Troy: I  would fain have armed to-day,</div>
                              <div class="line">but my Nell would not have it so. How chance my</div>
                              <div class="line">brother Troilus went not?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELEN</div>
                              <div class="line">He hangs the lip at something: you know all, Lord Pandarus.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Not I, honey-sweet queen. I long to hear how they</div>
                              <div class="line">sped to-day. You'll remember your brother's excuse?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                              <div class="line">To a hair.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Farewell, sweet queen.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELEN</div>
                              <div class="line">Commend me to your niece.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I will, sweet queen.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <p>A retreat sounded</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                              <div class="line">They're come from field: let us to Priam's hall,</div>
                              <div class="line">To greet the warriors. Sweet Helen, I must woo you</div>
                              <div class="line">To help unarm our Hector: his stubborn buckles,</div>
                              <div class="line">With these your white enchanting fingers touch'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall more obey than to the edge of steel</div>
                              <div class="line">Or force of Greekish sinews; you shall do more</div>
                              <div class="line">Than all the island kings,--disarm great Hector.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELEN</div>
                              <div class="line">'Twill make us proud to be his servant, Paris;</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, what he shall receive of us in duty</div>
                              <div class="line">Gives us more palm in beauty than we have,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, overshines ourself.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet, above thought I love thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.6.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  The same. Pandarus' orchard.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter PANDARUS and Troilus's Boy, meeting</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">How now! where's thy master? at my cousin</div>
                              <div class="line">Cressida's?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Boy</div>
                              <div class="line">No, sir; he stays for you to conduct him thither.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">O, here he comes.</div>
                              <p>Enter TROILUS</p>
                              <div class="line">How now, how now!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Sirrah, walk off.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit Boy</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Have you seen my cousin?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">No, Pandarus: I stalk about her door,</div>
                              <div class="line">Like a strange soul upon the Stygian banks</div>
                              <div class="line">Staying for waftage. O, be thou my Charon,</div>
                              <div class="line">And give me swift transportance to those fields</div>
                              <div class="line">Where I may wallow in the lily-beds</div>
                              <div class="line">Proposed for the deserver! O gentle Pandarus,</div>
                              <div class="line">From Cupid's shoulder pluck his painted wings</div>
                              <div class="line">And fly with me to Cressid!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Walk here i' the orchard, I'll bring her straight.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I am giddy; expectation whirls me round.</div>
                              <div class="line">The imaginary relish is so sweet</div>
                              <div class="line">That it enchants my sense: what will it be,</div>
                              <div class="line">When that the watery palate tastes indeed</div>
                              <div class="line">Love's thrice repured nectar? death, I fear me,</div>
                              <div class="line">Swooning destruction, or some joy too fine,</div>
                              <div class="line">Too subtle-potent, tuned too sharp in sweetness,</div>
                              <div class="line">For the capacity of my ruder powers:</div>
                              <div class="line">I fear it much; and I do fear besides,</div>
                              <div class="line">That I shall lose distinction in my joys;</div>
                              <div class="line">As doth a battle, when they charge on heaps</div>
                              <div class="line">The enemy flying.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter PANDARUS</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">She's making her ready, she'll come straight: you</div>
                              <div class="line">must be witty now. She does so blush, and fetches</div>
                              <div class="line">her wind so short, as if she were frayed with a</div>
                              <div class="line">sprite: I'll fetch her. It is the prettiest</div>
                              <div class="line">villain: she fetches her breath as short as a</div>
                              <div class="line">new-ta'en sparrow.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Even such a passion doth embrace my bosom:</div>
                              <div class="line">My heart beats thicker than a feverous pulse;</div>
                              <div class="line">And all my powers do their bestowing lose,</div>
                              <div class="line">Like vassalage at unawares encountering</div>
                              <div class="line">The eye of majesty.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter PANDARUS with CRESSIDA</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, come, what need you blush? shame's a baby.</div>
                              <div class="line">Here she is now: swear the oaths now to her that</div>
                              <div class="line">you have sworn to me. What, are you gone again?</div>
                              <div class="line">you must be watched ere you be made tame, must you?</div>
                              <div class="line">Come your ways, come your ways; an you draw backward,</div>
                              <div class="line">we'll put you i' the fills. Why do you not speak to</div>
                              <div class="line">her? Come, draw this curtain, and let's see your</div>
                              <div class="line">picture. Alas the day, how loath you are to offend</div>
                              <div class="line">daylight! an 'twere dark, you'ld close sooner.</div>
                              <div class="line">So, so; rub on, and kiss the mistress. How now!</div>
                              <div class="line">a kiss in fee-farm! build there, carpenter; the air</div>
                              <div class="line">is sweet. Nay, you shall fight your hearts out ere</div>
                              <div class="line">I part you. The falcon as the tercel, for all the</div>
                              <div class="line">ducks i' the river: go to, go to.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">You have bereft me of all words, lady.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Words pay no debts, give her deeds: but she'll</div>
                              <div class="line">bereave you o' the deeds too, if she call your</div>
                              <div class="line">activity in question. What, billing again? Here's</div>
                              <div class="line">'In witness whereof the parties interchangeably'--</div>
                              <div class="line">Come in, come in: I'll go get a fire.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Will you walk in, my lord?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">O Cressida, how often have I wished me thus!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Wished, my lord! The gods grant,--O my lord!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">What should they grant? what makes this pretty</div>
                              <div class="line">abruption? What too curious dreg espies my sweet</div>
                              <div class="line">lady in the fountain of our love?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">More dregs than water, if my fears have eyes.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Fears make devils of cherubims; they never see truly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Blind fear, that seeing reason leads, finds safer</div>
                              <div class="line">footing than blind reason stumbling without fear: to</div>
                              <div class="line">fear the worst oft cures the worse.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">O, let my lady apprehend no fear: in all Cupid's</div>
                              <div class="line">pageant there is presented no monster.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor nothing monstrous neither?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Nothing, but our undertakings; when we vow to weep</div>
                              <div class="line">seas, live in fire, eat rocks, tame tigers; thinking</div>
                              <div class="line">it harder for our mistress to devise imposition</div>
                              <div class="line">enough than for us to undergo any difficulty imposed.</div>
                              <div class="line">This is the monstruosity in love, lady, that the will</div>
                              <div class="line">is infinite and the execution confined, that the</div>
                              <div class="line">desire is boundless and the act a slave to limit.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">They say all lovers swear more performance than they</div>
                              <div class="line">are able and yet reserve an ability that they never</div>
                              <div class="line">perform, vowing more than the perfection of ten and</div>
                              <div class="line">discharging less than the tenth part of one. They</div>
                              <div class="line">that have the voice of lions and the act of hares,</div>
                              <div class="line">are they not monsters?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Are there such? such are not we: praise us as we</div>
                              <div class="line">are tasted, allow us as we prove; our head shall go</div>
                              <div class="line">bare till merit crown it: no perfection in reversion</div>
                              <div class="line">shall have a praise in present: we will not name</div>
                              <div class="line">desert before his birth, and, being born, his addition</div>
                              <div class="line">shall be humble. Few words to fair faith: Troilus</div>
                              <div class="line">shall be such to Cressid as what envy can say worst</div>
                              <div class="line">shall be a mock for his truth, and what truth can</div>
                              <div class="line">speak truest not truer than Troilus.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Will you walk in, my lord?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter PANDARUS</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">What, blushing still? have you not done talking yet?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, uncle, what folly I commit, I dedicate to you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I thank you for that: if my lord get a boy of you,</div>
                              <div class="line">you'll give him me. Be true to my lord: if he</div>
                              <div class="line">flinch, chide me for it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">You know now your hostages; your uncle's word and my</div>
                              <div class="line">firm faith.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, I'll give my word for her too: our kindred,</div>
                              <div class="line">though they be long ere they are wooed, they are</div>
                              <div class="line">constant being won: they are burs, I can tell you;</div>
                              <div class="line">they'll stick where they are thrown.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Boldness comes to me now, and brings me heart.</div>
                              <div class="line">Prince Troilus, I have loved you night and day</div>
                              <div class="line">For many weary months.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Why was my Cressid then so hard to win?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Hard to seem won: but I was won, my lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">With the first glance that ever--pardon me--</div>
                              <div class="line">If I confess much, you will play the tyrant.</div>
                              <div class="line">I love you now; but not, till now, so much</div>
                              <div class="line">But I might master it: in faith, I lie;</div>
                              <div class="line">My thoughts were like unbridled children, grown</div>
                              <div class="line">Too headstrong for their mother. See, we fools!</div>
                              <div class="line">Why have I blabb'd? who shall be true to us,</div>
                              <div class="line">When we are so unsecret to ourselves?</div>
                              <div class="line">But, though I loved you well, I woo'd you not;</div>
                              <div class="line">And yet, good faith, I wish'd myself a man,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or that we women had men's privilege</div>
                              <div class="line">Of speaking first. Sweet, bid me hold my tongue,</div>
                              <div class="line">For in this rapture I shall surely speak</div>
                              <div class="line">The thing I shall repent. See, see, your silence,</div>
                              <div class="line">Cunning in dumbness, from my weakness draws</div>
                              <div class="line">My very soul of counsel! stop my mouth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">And shall, albeit sweet music issues thence.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Pretty, i' faith.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, I do beseech you, pardon me;</div>
                              <div class="line">'Twas not my purpose, thus to beg a kiss:</div>
                              <div class="line">I am ashamed. O heavens! what have I done?</div>
                              <div class="line">For this time will I take my leave, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Your leave, sweet Cressid!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Leave! an you take leave till to-morrow morning,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Pray you, content you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">What offends you, lady?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, mine own company.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">You cannot shun Yourself.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me go and try:</div>
                              <div class="line">I have a kind of self resides with you;</div>
                              <div class="line">But an unkind self, that itself will leave,</div>
                              <div class="line">To be another's fool. I would be gone:</div>
                              <div class="line">Where is my wit? I know not what I speak.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Well know they what they speak that speak so wisely.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Perchance, my lord, I show more craft than love;</div>
                              <div class="line">And fell so roundly to a large confession,</div>
                              <div class="line">To angle for your thoughts: but you are wise,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or else you love not, for to be wise and love</div>
                              <div class="line">Exceeds man's might; that dwells with gods above.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">O that I thought it could be in a woman--</div>
                              <div class="line">As, if it can, I will presume in you--</div>
                              <div class="line">To feed for aye her ramp and flames of love;</div>
                              <div class="line">To keep her constancy in plight and youth,</div>
                              <div class="line">Outliving beauty's outward, with a mind</div>
                              <div class="line">That doth renew swifter than blood decays!</div>
                              <div class="line">Or that persuasion could but thus convince me,</div>
                              <div class="line">That my integrity and truth to you</div>
                              <div class="line">Might be affronted with the match and weight</div>
                              <div class="line">Of such a winnow'd purity in love;</div>
                              <div class="line">How were I then uplifted! but, alas!</div>
                              <div class="line">I am as true as truth's simplicity</div>
                              <div class="line">And simpler than the infancy of truth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">In that I'll war with you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">O virtuous fight,</div>
                              <div class="line">When right with right wars who shall be most right!</div>
                              <div class="line">True swains in love shall in the world to come</div>
                              <div class="line">Approve their truths by Troilus: when their rhymes,</div>
                              <div class="line">Full of protest, of oath and big compare,</div>
                              <div class="line">Want similes, truth tired with iteration,</div>
                              <div class="line">As true as steel, as plantage to the moon,</div>
                              <div class="line">As sun to day, as turtle to her mate,</div>
                              <div class="line">As iron to adamant, as earth to the centre,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet, after all comparisons of truth,</div>
                              <div class="line">As truth's authentic author to be cited,</div>
                              <div class="line">'As true as Troilus' shall crown up the verse,</div>
                              <div class="line">And sanctify the numbers.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Prophet may you be!</div>
                              <div class="line">If I be false, or swerve a hair from truth,</div>
                              <div class="line">When time is old and hath forgot itself,</div>
                              <div class="line">When waterdrops have worn the stones of Troy,</div>
                              <div class="line">And blind oblivion swallow'd cities up,</div>
                              <div class="line">And mighty states characterless are grated</div>
                              <div class="line">To dusty nothing, yet let memory,</div>
                              <div class="line">From false to false, among false maids in love,</div>
                              <div class="line">Upbraid my falsehood! when they've said 'as false</div>
                              <div class="line">As air, as water, wind, or sandy earth,</div>
                              <div class="line">As fox to lamb, as wolf to heifer's calf,</div>
                              <div class="line">Pard to the hind, or stepdame to her son,'</div>
                              <div class="line">'Yea,' let them say, to stick the heart of falsehood,</div>
                              <div class="line">'As false as Cressid.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Go to, a bargain made: seal it, seal it; I'll be the</div>
                              <div class="line">witness. Here I hold your hand, here my cousin's.</div>
                              <div class="line">If ever you prove false one to another, since I have</div>
                              <div class="line">taken such pains to bring you together, let all</div>
                              <div class="line">pitiful goers-between be called to the world's end</div>
                              <div class="line">after my name; call them all Pandars; let all</div>
                              <div class="line">constant men be Troiluses, all false women Cressids,</div>
                              <div class="line">and all brokers-between Pandars! say, amen.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TROILUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Amen.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CRESSIDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Amen.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PANDARUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Amen. Whereupon I will show you a chamber with a</div>
                              <div class="line">bed; which bed, because it shall not speak of your</div>
                              <div class="line">pretty encounters, press it to death: away!</div>
                              <div class="line">And Cupid grant all tongue-tied maidens here</div>
                              <div class="line">Bed, chamber, Pandar to provide this gear!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.6.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter AGAMEMNON, ULYSSES, DIOMEDES, NESTOR, AJAX,
MENELAUS, and CALCHAS</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CALCHAS</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, princes, for the service I have done you,</div>
                              <div class="line">The advantage of the time prompts me aloud</div>
                              <div class="line">To call for recompense. Appear it to your mind</div>
                              <div class="line">That, through the sight I bear in things to love,</div>
                              <div class="line">I have abandon'd Troy, left my possession,</div>
                              <div class="line">Incurr'd a traitor's name; exposed myself,</div>
                              <div class="line">From certain and possess'd conveniences,</div>
                              <div class="line">To doubtful fortunes; sequestering from me all</div>
                              <div class="line">That time, acquaintance, custom and condition</div>
                              <div class="line">Made tame and most familiar to my nature,</div>
                              <div class="line">And here, to do you service, am become</div>
                              <div class="line">As new into the world, strange, unacquainted:</div>
                              <div class="line">I do beseech you, as in way of taste,</div>
                              <div class="line">To give me now a little benefit,</div>
                              <div class="line">Out of those many register'd in promise,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which, you say, live to come in my behalf.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AGAMEMNON</div>
                              <div class="line">What wouldst thou of us, Trojan? make demand.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CALCHAS</div>
                              <div class="line">You have a Trojan prisoner, call'd Antenor,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yesterday took: Troy holds him very dear.</div>
                              <div class="line">Oft have you--often have you thanks therefore--</div>
                              <div class="line">Desired my Cressid in right great exchange,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whom Troy hath still denied: but this Antenor,</div>
                              <div class="line">I know, is such a wrest in their affairs</div>
                              <div class="line">That their negotiations all must slack,</div>
                              <div class="line">Wanting his manage; and they will almost</div>
                              <div class="line">Give us a prince of blood, a son of Priam,</div>
                              <div class="line">In change of him: let him be sent, great princes,</div>
                              <div class="line">And he shall buy my daughter; and her presence</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall quite strike off all service I have done,</div>
                              <div class="line">In most accepted pain.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AGAMEMNON</div>
                              <div class="line">Let Diomedes bear him,</div>
                              <div class="line">And bring us Cressid hither: Calchas shall have</div>
                              <div class="line">What he requests of us. Good Diomed,</div>
                              <div class="line">Furnish you fairly for this interchange:</div>
                              <div class="line">Withal bring word if Hector will to-morrow</div>
                              <div class="line">Be answer'd in his challenge: Ajax is ready.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DIOMEDES</div>
                              <div class="line">This shall I undertake; and 'tis a burden</div>
                              <div class="line">Which I am proud to bear.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt DIOMEDES and CALCHAS</p>
                        <p>Enter ACHILLES and PATROCLUS, before their tent</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ULYSSES</div>
                              <div class="line">Achilles stands i' the entrance of his tent:</div>
                              <div class="line">Please it our general to pass strangely by him,</div>
                              <div class="line">As if he were forgot; and, princes all,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lay negligent and loose regard upon him:</div>
                              <div class="line">I will come last. 'Tis like he'll question me</div>
                              <div class="line">Why such unplausive eyes are bent on him:</div>
                              <div class="line">If so, I have derision medicinable,</div>
                              <div class="line">To use between your strangeness and his pride,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which his own will shall have desire to drink:</div>
                              <div class="line">It may be good: pride hath no other glass</div>
                              <div class="line">To show itself but pride, for supple knees</div>
                              <div class="line">Feed arrogance and are the proud man's fees.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AGAMEMNON</div>
                              <div class="line">We'll execute your purpose, and put on</div>
                              <div class="line">A form of strangeness as we pass along:</div>
                              <div class="line">So do each lord, and either greet him not,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or else disdainfully, which shall shake him more</div>
                              <div class="line">Than if not look'd on. I will lead the way.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                              <div class="line">What, comes the general to speak with me?</div>
                              <div class="line">You know my mind, I'll fight no more 'gainst Troy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AGAMEMNON</div>
                              <div class="line">What says Achilles? would he aught with us?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NESTOR</div>
                              <div class="line">Would you, my lord, aught with the general?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                              <div class="line">No.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NESTOR</div>
                              <div class="line">Nothing, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AGAMEMNON</div>
                              <div class="line">The better.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt AGAMEMNON and NESTOR</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Good day, good day.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MENELAUS</div>
                              <div class="line">How do you? how do you?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                              <div class="line">What, does the cuckold scorn me?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AJAX</div>
                              <div class="line">How now, Patroclus!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Good morrow, Ajax.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AJAX</div>
                              <div class="line">Ha?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Good morrow.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AJAX</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, and good next day too.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                              <div class="line">What mean these fellows? Know they not Achilles?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PATROCLUS</div>
                              <div class="line">They pass by strangely: they were used to bend</div>
                              <div class="line">To send their smiles before them to Achilles;</div>
                              <div class="line">To come as humbly as they used to creep</div>
                              <div class="line">To holy altars.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                              <div class="line">What, am I poor of late?</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis certain, greatness, once fall'n out with fortune,</div>
                              <div class="line">Must fall out with men too: what the declined is</div>
                              <div class="line">He shall as soon read in the eyes of others</div>
                              <div class="line">As feel in his own fall; for men, like butterflies,</div>
                              <div class="line">Show not their mealy wings but to the summer,</div>
                              <div class="line">And not a man, for being simply man,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath any honour, but honour for those honours</div>
                              <div class="line">That are without him, as place, riches, favour,</div>
                              <div class="line">Prizes of accident as oft as merit:</div>
                              <div class="line">Which when they fall, as being slippery standers,</div>
                              <div class="line">The love that lean'd on them as slippery too,</div>
                              <div class="line">Do one pluck down another and together</div>
                              <div class="line">Die in the fall. But 'tis not so with me:</div>
                              <div class="line">Fortune and I are friends: I do enjoy</div>
                              <div class="line">At ample point all that I did possess,</div>
                              <div class="line">Save these men's looks; who do, methinks, find out</div>
                              <div class="line">Something not worth in me such rich beholding</div>
                              <div class="line">As they have often given. Here is Ulysses;</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll interrupt his reading.</div>
                              <div class="line">How now Ulysses!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ULYSSES</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, great Thetis' son!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                              <div class="line">What are you reading?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ULYSSES</div>
                              <div class="line">A strange fellow here</div>
                              <div class="line">Writes me: 'That man, how dearly ever parted,</div>
                              <div class="line">How much in having, or without or in,</div>
                              <div class="line">Cannot make boast to have that which he hath,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor feels not what he owes, but by reflection;</div>
                              <div class="line">As when his virtues shining upon others</div>
                              <div class="line">Heat them and they retort that heat again</div>
                              <div class="line">To the first giver.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                              <div class="line">This is not strange, Ulysses.</div>
                              <div class="line">The beauty that is borne here in the face</div>
                              <div class="line">The bearer knows not, but commends itself</div>
                              <div class="line">To others' eyes; nor doth the eye itself,</div>
                              <div class="line">That most pure spirit of sense, behold itself,</div>
                              <div class="line">Not going from itself; but eye to eye opposed</div>
                              <div class="line">Salutes each other with each other's form;</div>
                              <div class="line">For speculation turns not to itself,</div>
                              <div class="line">Till it hath travell'd and is mirror'd there</div>
                              <div class="line">Where it may see itself. This is not strange at all.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ULYSSES</div>
                              <div class="line">I do not strain at the position,--</div>
                              <div class="line">It is familiar,--but at the author's drift;</div>
                              <div class="line">Who, in his circumstance, expressly proves</div>
                              <div class="line">That no man is the lord of any thing,</div>
                              <div class="line">Though in and of him there be much consisting,</div>
                              <div class="line">Till he communicate his parts to others:</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor doth he of himself know them for aught</div>
                              <div class="line">Till he behold them form'd in the applause</div>
                              <div class="line">Where they're extended; who, like an arch,</div>
                              <div class="line">reverberates</div>
                              <div class="line">The voice again, or, like a gate of steel</div>
                              <div class="line">Fronting the sun, receives and renders back</div>
                              <div class="line">His figure and his heat.  I was much wrapt in this;</div>
                              <div class="line">And apprehended here immediately</div>
                              <div class="line">The unknown Ajax.</div>
                              <div class="line">Heavens, what a man is there! a very horse,</div>
                              <div class="line">That has he knows not what. Nature, what things there are</div>
                              <div class="line">Most abject in regard and dear in use!</div>
                              <div class="line">What things again most dear in the esteem</div>
                              <div class="line">And poor in worth! Now shall we see to-morrow--</div>
                              <div class="line">An act that very chance doth throw upon him--</div>
                              <div class="line">Ajax renown'd. O heavens, what some men do,</div>
                              <div class="line">While some men leave to do!</div>
                              <div class="line">How some men creep in skittish fortune's hall,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whiles others play the idiots in her eyes!</div>
                              <div class="line">How one man eats into another's pride,</div>
                              <div class="line">While pride is fasting in his wantonness!</div>
                              <div class="line">To see these Grecian lords!--why, even already</div>
                              <div class="line">They clap the lubber Ajax on the shoulder,</div>
                              <div class="line">As if his foot were on brave Hector's breast</div>
                              <div class="line">And great Troy shrieking.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                              <div class="line">I do believe it; for they pass'd by me</div>
                              <div class="line">As misers do by beggars, neither gave to me</div>
                              <div class="line">Good word nor look: what, are my deeds forgot?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ULYSSES</div>
                              <div class="line">Time hath, my lord, a wallet at his back,</div>
                              <div class="line">Wherein he puts alms for oblivion,</div>
                              <div class="line">A great-sized monster of ingratitudes:</div>
                              <div class="line">Those scraps are good deeds past; which are devour'd</div>
                              <div class="line">As fast as they are made, forgot as soon</div>
                              <div class="line">As done: perseverance, dear my lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">Keeps honour bright: to have done is to hang</div>
                              <div class="line">Quite out of fashion, like a rusty mail</div>
                              <div class="line">In monumental mockery. Take the instant way;</div>
                              <div class="line">For honour travels in a strait so narrow,</div>
                              <div class="line">Where one but goes abreast: keep then the path;</div>
                              <div class="line">For emulation hath a thousand sons</div>
                              <div class="line">That one by one pursue: if you give way,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or hedge aside from the direct forthright,</div>
                              <div class="line">Like to an enter'd tide, they all rush by</div>
                              <div class="line">And leave you hindmost;</div>
                              <div class="line">Or like a gallant horse fall'n in first rank,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lie there for pavement to the abject rear,</div>
                              <div class="line">O'er-run and trampled on: then what they do in present,</div>
                              <div class="line">Though less than yours in past, must o'ertop yours;</div>
                              <div class="line">For time is like a fashionable host</div>
                              <div class="line">That slightly shakes his parting guest by the hand,</div>
                              <div class="line">And with his arms outstretch'd, as he would fly,</div>
                              <div class="line">Grasps in the comer: welcome ever smiles,</div>
                              <div class="line">And farewell goes out sighing. O, let not</div>
                              <div class="line">virtue seek</div>
                              <div class="line">Remuneration for the thing it was;</div>
                              <div class="line">For beauty, wit,</div>
                              <div class="line">High birth, vigour of bone, desert in service,</div>
                              <div class="line">Love, friendship, charity, are subjects all</div>
                              <div class="line">To envious and calumniating time.</div>
                              <div class="line">One touch of nature makes the whole world kin,</div>
                              <div class="line">That all with one consent praise new-born gawds,</div>
                              <div class="line">Though they are made and moulded of things past,</div>
                              <div class="line">And give to dust that is a little gilt</div>
                              <div class="line">More laud than gilt o'er-dusted.</div>
                              <div class="line">The present eye praises the present object.</div>
                              <div class="line">Then marvel not, thou great and complete man,</div>
                              <div class="line">That all the Greeks begin to worship Ajax;</div>
                              <div class="line">Since things in motion sooner catch the eye</div>
                              <div class="line">Than what not stirs. The cry went once on thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">And still it might, and yet it may again,</div>
                              <div class="line">If thou wouldst not entomb thyself alive</div>
                              <div class="line">And case thy reputation in thy tent;</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose glorious deeds, but in these fields of late,</div>
                              <div class="line">Made emulous missions 'mongst the gods themselves</div>
                              <div class="line">And drave great Mars to faction.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Of this my privacy</div>
                              <div class="line">I have strong reasons.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ULYSSES</div>
                              <div class="line">But 'gainst your privacy</div>
                              <div class="line">The reasons are more potent and heroical:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis known, Achilles, that you are in love</div>
                              <div class="line">With one of Priam's daughters.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Ha! known!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ULYSSES</div>
                              <div class="line">Is that a wonder?</div>
                              <div class="line">The providence that's in a watchful state</div>
                              <div class="line">Knows almost every grain of Plutus' gold,</div>
                              <div class="line">Finds bottom in the uncomprehensive deeps,</div>
                              <div class="line">Keeps place with thought and almost, like the gods,</div>
                              <div class="line">Does thoughts unveil in their dumb cradles.</div>
                              <div class="line">There is a mystery--with whom relation</div>
                              <div class="line">Durst never meddle--in the soul of state;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which hath an operation more divine</div>
                              <div class="line">Than breath or pen can give expressure to:</div>
                              <div class="line">All the commerce that you have had with Troy</div>
                              <div class="line">As perfectly is ours as yours, my lord;</div>
                              <div class="line">And better would it fit Achilles much</div>
                              <div class="line">To throw down Hector than Polyxena:</div>
                              <div class="line">But it must grieve young Pyrrhus now at home,</div>
                              <div class="line">When fame shall in our islands sound her trump,</div>
                              <div class="line">And all the Greekish girls shall tripping sing,</div>
                              <div class="line">'Great Hector's sister did Achilles win,</div>
                              <div class="line">But our great Ajax bravely beat down him.'</div>
                              <div class="line">Farewell, my lord: I as your lover speak;</div>
                              <div class="line">The fool slides o'er the ice that you should break.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PATROCLUS</div>
                              <div class="line">To this effect, Achilles, have I moved you:</div>
                              <div class="line">A woman impudent and mannish grown</div>
                              <div class="line">Is not more loathed than an effeminate man</div>
                              <div class="line">In time of action. I stand condemn'd for this;</div>
                              <div class="line">They think my little stomach to the war</div>
                              <div class="line">And your great love to me restrains you thus:</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet, rouse yourself; and the weak wanton Cupid</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall from your neck unloose his amorous fold,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, like a dew-drop from the lion's mane,</div>
                              <div class="line">Be shook to air.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall Ajax fight with Hector?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PATROCLUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, and perhaps receive much honour by him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                              <div class="line">I see my reputation is at stake</div>
                              <div class="line">My fame is shrewdly gored.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PATROCLUS</div>
                              <div class="line">O, then, beware;</div>
                              <div class="line">Those wounds heal ill that men do give themselves:</div>
                              <div class="line">Omission to do what is necessary</div>
                              <div class="line">Seals a commission to a blank of danger;</div>
                              <div class="line">And danger, like an ague, subtly taints</div>
                              <div class="line">Even then when we sit idly in the sun.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Go call Thersites hither, sweet Patroclus:</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll send the fool to Ajax and desire him</div>
                              <div class="line">To invite the Trojan lords after the combat</div>
                              <div class="line">To see us here unarm'd: I have a woman's longing,</div>
                              <div class="line">An appetite that I am sick withal,</div>
                              <div class="line">To see great Hector in his weeds of peace,</div>
                              <div class="line">To talk with him and to behold his visage,</div>
                              <div class="line">Even to my full of view.</div>
                              <p>Enter THERSITES</p>
                              <div class="line">A labour saved!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THERSITES</div>
                              <div class="line">A wonder!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                              <div class="line">What?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THERSITES</div>
                              <div class="line">Ajax goes up and down the field, asking for himself.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                              <div class="line">How so?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THERSITES</div>
                              <div class="line">He must fight singly to-morrow with Hector, and is so</div>
                              <div class="line">prophetically proud of an heroical cudgelling that he</div>
                              <div class="line">raves in saying nothing.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                              <div class="line">How can that be?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THERSITES</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, he stalks up and down like a peacock,--a stride</div>
                              <div class="line">and a stand: ruminates like an hostess that hath no</div>
                              <div class="line">arithmetic but her brain to set down her reckoning:</div>
                              <div class="line">bites his lip with a politic regard, as who should</div>
                              <div class="line">say 'There were wit in this head, an 'twould out;'</div>
                              <div class="line">and so there is, but it lies as coldly in him as fire</div>
                              <div class="line">in a flint, which will not show without knocking.</div>
                              <div class="line">The man's undone forever; for if Hector break not his</div>
                              <div class="line">neck i' the combat, he'll break 't himself in</div>
                              <div class="line">vain-glory. He knows not me: I said 'Good morrow,</div>
                              <div class="line">Ajax;' and he replies 'Thanks, Agamemnon.' What think</div>
                              <div class="line">you of this man that takes me for the general? He's</div>
                              <div class="line">grown a very land-fish, language-less, a monster.</div>
                              <div class="line">A plague of opinion! a man may wear it on both</div>
                              <div class="line">sides, like a leather jerkin.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ACHILLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou must be my ambassador to him, Thersites.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THERSITES</div>
                              <div class="line">Who, I? why, he'll answer nobody; he professes not</div>
                              <div class="line">answering: speaking is for beggars; he wears his</div>
                              <div class="line">tongue in's arms. I will put on his presence: let</div>
